description:
One of my personal favorites & in such a cute small cafe in hidden in Haye's valley, Welcome to Urban Ritual!
Went with a friend on a Sunday afternoon & we went ahead & tried the Crème Brûlée & House Milk Tea!

-Verdicts
Crème Brûlée - I personally would get this without boba, its delicious, & if you want sweeter, just get it boba!
House Milk Tea - This was perfect for me since I wanted something light/sweet & they have some at the counter to try as a sample!
I'm looking forward to trying the Matcha Toffee next time!

Its a beautiful cafe with awesome vibes, & I will say that it can get pretty popping around here, so definitely expect a wait sometimes. 

So far in my Boba Bay Quest, I would rate this a must place to try if you happen to be in the SF area, & the staff are super nice to accommodate you with great recommendations!
author: Truc T.

description:
Overall, unique and delicious flavors! 
We ordered the matcha toffee drink and the creme brûlée drink. The matcha drink had bits of toffee in it which I thought added some nice texture. However, the matcha taste wasn't as strong as I'd have liked it to be. The creme brûlée drink had a really rich and sweet flavor, but I'd definitely recommend getting the creme on the side because it's super sweet. The boba pearls itself were just average because they weren't very soft or sweet. 
Would come here again to try all the other drinks!
author: Rebecca Z.

description:
Good drinks even though it's half ice. I am very disappointed that there is no restroom here since sometimes I stay here for a couple hours on my laptop to do work. They have free WiFi which is nice.

I always get the matcha toffee. I find the creme brulee to be too sweet.
author: Alicia L.

description:
Love this boba shop - probably my favorite in the entire city (or even Bay Area)! My favorite drink is the Matcha Toffee and I add Oatly to it to make it even more delicious. I love that it's not too sweet (you can adjust sweetness) and there are yummy toffee bits sprinkled on top. 

I also have tried a few other drinks including the Creme Brulee. I wasn't a huge fan of the creme brulee because it was too sweet and texture too thick for me, and you can't adjust the sweetness on that one. It kind of felt like drinking a creme brulee which isn't as good as it sounds.
author: Jeanette S.

description:
With so many boba places opening up in every corners of the city, I become more and more picky to what boba places I go to. I've had this place bookmarked for awhile, and one my coworker has been telling me to try it out. I mean I'm trying to diet over here but here I am, drinking boba 2x a day. 

Their menu is small and very unique. I got the white grape oolong yuzu and my friend got the cream brûlée. Both drinks were very good! Very unique, I love the yuzu pieces in my drinks and the cream brûlée is a sweeter drink of course with fresh milk so u gotta mix it good. Total for both comes to $10 which is standard SF price.

The only bad thing is the parking around the area but I won't use that against them :)
author: Debbie D.

description: It was disappointing having the Strawberry Milk Bar after enjoying so much their Crème Brûlée. And I suppose it is in part my fault. I keep on forgetting to ask for less ice. But usually that isn't an issue (see: QualiTea). The cups are substantially smaller here and/or they add more ice. Either way the last third or so of this drink was exceedingly watery.  There were chewy, springy boba aplenty and not enough of the actual drink. I would suggest skipping this one. And note to self: REMEMBER TO GET LESS ICE.
author: Lauren H.

description:
This place is located on a hill near Hayes Valley. If there are no seats inside (which is very likely), you can always bring your drink to the nearby park! 

I ordered the matcha with pea milk, unsweetened and with honey boba. It was pretty expensive at $5.75, but I liked the thickness of the pea milk (although it did taste a lot like dry green peas if I thought too hard about it). The boba added sweetness, so there was no need for extra sugar. 

There are some interesting flavors on the menu like the strawberry bar and creme brulee; will try those out when I feel more indulgent!
author: Sophie W.

description:
My friends and I were in the mood for boba for dessert, but unfortunately boba guys was closed (yes I know we have on in LA, just wanted to try and compare the LA vs SF location). Thankfully urban ritual was down the street from our dinner location so we decided to stop by. We came around 9pm Sunday and it was packed with people, but no line so I assume we just beat the rush. 

I had no idea what I wanted to get. I like that theres a build your own and  a set menu to choose from. 

They had samples of the honey oolong milk tea and I tried it and loved it. Got it with boba and regular sweetness (didn't realize the sample was watered down). I loved their boba. Super soft (even an hour later). The regular sweetness was a bit too sweet for me, probably should've gotten less sweet. My fiance got the strawberry milk bar which literally tasted like strawberry milk (still good though!) 

GREAT boba shop in SF! Nicely lit (You literally cannot miss this place walking at night) and super nice employees!
author: Tiffany K.

description:
After seeing pop up all over my social media, I decided to come try this place! When I got there, the cashier was super friendly and helpful offering us samples and giving us his recommendations. I wanted my drinks with oat milk, but since they ran out, the cashier offered to let me sample the rest of the non-dairy options (pea milk - very creamy, kind of tastes like vanilla soy milk; macadamia nut milk - lighter and has a nutty taste)

I ended up ordering the Strawberry Milk Bar with boba and macadamia nut milk and the Hojicha Hot Chocolate (SECRET MENU ITEM!!). I actually really enjoyed the strawberry milk bar drink - it wasn't overly sweet and the boba perfect! The hojicha hot chocolate was not my favorite. It was quite bitter, had a very dark chocolate taste and you couldn't taste any part of the hojicha - I wouldn't get this again, but it's definitely worth a try, especially if you love dark chocolate!

Overall Urban Ritual was alright. It's a spot that's out of the way for me, and I definitely wouldn't make my way out to Hayes just to get a boba. Also, I find their drinks really pricy for what they are. Each drink starts at about $4.25-$4.75 and can add up if you want additional toppings or if you need a milk substitute!
author: Stacey Y.

description:
Not a huge fan of the location, on the busiest one way street. 

Although, I like the interior design of the place. Very simple and cute. Upon walking in, you can smell the "sweetness" or the aroma of the fresh made boba. 

we ordered the creme brulee, which seemed like a top order. I didn't know it came with boba or else I would've skipped on it. It was fresh and the texture was on point. It's a very thick consistency, almost smoothie like because of the creme brulee filling. I substituted the milk for pea milk, which could be the reason why the drink was thicker than expected. I chose pea milk because I've never tried it and it was the closest thing to "soy/almond milk" that they had to offer. 

boyfriend got the matcha toffee. they add in toffee bits to the top. he also substituted for the pea milk and said it made the drink thicker. 

Overall, we like the place. Not necessarily a fan of the drinks we ordered. Maybe (in the future) we wont sub for the pea milk. The drinks are unique to try, but we'll stick to the basics.
author: Audrey K.

description:
I'm sitting at work one day when a message pops up on my computer that says, "What would you walk a mile for?" I got so excited, I screamed, "Balls!" Yup, I said it so loud my co-worker came running to my cube...

Co-Worker: "Porsche, did you just scream something?"

Me: "Yes, girl! I'll walk a mile for some good balls!"

My girlfriend looks at me like o-O

Co-worker: "Please do not tell me this is another one of your porno food talks."

Yup, my co-workers know me too damn well! Admittedly, its true- I compare my food to fun adult nightlife, and Ruban Ritual is one of those places! 

Oh Ma Gaw, Yess! Someone, please tell me why I'm so addicted to boba milk tea?! I had one taste of Urban Ritual and I've never been the same! The boba balls are just so chewy and tasty, they make it with honey and it's DELICIOUS! Those Boba milk teas are to die for, you hear me?! I walk 1.6 miles just to get a boba a week! The location is walking distance from my job. I don't know if that's a good thing or a bad thing. The inside of the place is small with minimal seating. The menu is really detailed and walks you through the steps to order. The workers here are extremely friendly and efficient. 

I absolutely fell in love with their Strawberry Milk Bar and, as of today, I have also fallen in love with the Crème Brulee; if you're feenin' something madd sweet, this one's for YOU! Don't expect all the powered flavors under the sun, as they only have a few fruit flavors and the rest is made with fresh fruit. 

Honestly, this review cannot do ANY justice to what my taste buds experience when they get some good ol' Urban Ritual. You just need to go and experience it yourself.
author: Porsche C.

description: We stopped by because of a friend's recommendation and I was so glad we did!! We had the Matcha toffee and the Creme brulee and oh my goodness was it sweet and delicious. Their house made toffee paired so well and their brown sugar in the creme brulee gave a nice roasted flavor. I've been told to try the Matcha toffee with their pudding as well! I'd definitely come here again!
author: Alina L.

description:
Me and my friend decided to give Urban Ritual another chance because we didn't like the drinks we got the first time. On our first visit, we got the Matcha Toffee and the Creme Brûlée. We weren't a big fan of the toffee brittle texture in the drink and we both thought the Creme Brûlée was way too sweet.

During this visit, me and my friend got the Strawberry Milk Bar with Boba and the Hojicha Hot Chocolate(Secret Menu item). The Strawberry Milk Bar was really good, very refreshing with a creamy strawberry taste. The boba also had a great chew to it. The Hojicha Hot Chocolate was very rich, and had a dark chocolate taste. It was also topped with a Hojicha Marshmallow. I enjoyed it but my friend thought it was a bit bitter. If you are a fan of dark chocolate, I think you will like the Hojicha Hot Chocolate. 

I am really glad I gave Urban Ritual another chance. I really enjoyed the drinks and would order them again! The cashier was also really nice and helpful, he let us taste the different milks and gave us great recommendations!
author: Michael L.

description:
Been hearing good things about this place.  So I decided to try it out since I was in the area.  

I got the creme brulee drink.  It's a milk based drink with pieces creme brulee and boba mixed in.  There was also toasted sugar pieces sprinkled on top.  The boba was nice and warm!  After mixing everything together the drink tasted just like creme brulee, just with boba.  The sugar crystals added a nice crunch to the drink!  The con to this drink is that you can't change the sugar level.  I was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't overly sweet. It was just at the cusp of being too sweet.  All the milk really help keep it from being too sweet.  If you aren't into sweetness then maybe this drink isn't for you, but I didn't think it was crazy week or under sweet. 

Would I get this drink again?  Only if I'm feeling like I want a dessert.  The other thing I didnt like about this drink was that it isn't a milk TEA drink.  It's just a milk drink.  Next time I would just get a milk tea and maybe add the creme brulee topping if I'm feeling for a desserty drink.

Would be back to try other drinks if I'm in the area again.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
I was browsing on ubereats the other day when I stumbled upon Urban Ritual. Briefly browsing at the menu and looking at the photo up top, I knew I had to pay a visit. 

My friends and I were welcomed as soon as we walked in and were offered samples of two of their teas - Jasmine Milk and Chrysanthemum. Both were really refreshing and not too sweet at all. I ended up ordering the matcha toffee at 30% sugar with boba and absolutely loved it! The matcha flavor is prominent enough and the sweetness level was perfect for me - especially with the addition of crunchy toffee bits and sweet boba. I think the boba here is a bit better than most and was the perfect texture - soft but still nice and chewy. 

They have a build your own drink menu as well as a list of pre-built so there's actually quite a few options here. I can't wait to come back and try them all!
author: Janice L.

description:
I'm from the 626, the land of boba tea houses every corner, and this place gets my approval! I even came back for another 2 drinks before leaving for my flight back home!

I had the Creme Brulee and Matcha Toffee. The Matcha Toffee's not my fave, but I've seen many people ordering it. I loved the Creme Brulee! I believe they make the creme brulee pudding in house, so it's different than the average pudding topping. The "burnt sugar" is obviously the not so secret ingredient that turned the drink into an addiction. Customers have the option to have the burnt sugar put in or have it on the side. If you ordered it to go, they will have it on the side as well. 

The staff were very friendly & they have outlets all around the cafe. No restroom though.
author: Chelsea C.

description:
It took me way too long to try this place out but glad I was finally able to check it out this past weekend. I really like the layout of the shop. Felt very homey. I came here with my cousin and she got the Matcha toffee with regular milk and it pretty good but they probably could have eased up on the milk a little bit. I couldn't taste the matcha as much but it was still good. I got the creme brulee and I love how they have the option to substitute the milk with something else. The options were pea milk, oat milk or macadamia nut milk (all 50 cents extra). I got the macadamia nut because it gives it a little bit of a nuttier taste. I thought it was pretty darn good. It is pretty much creme brulee in a liquid form. It also comes with honey boba and it's one of the few places that actually makes it decent. Great texture but given the sweetness of my drink I can't tell if there was any honey on it. Overall it's a good place to get boba but it is a bit pricy. With the the macadamia nut milk my drink came out to be $5.75. I think most of the other drinks are $4.25, which is standard I guess. This is a great place to get dessert but as for tea I don't know yet. I'll just have to come back and try it!

REWARDS: They use FiveStars, so get those 10 drinks so you get 1 free!

PARKING: It's the city so if you're driving, all I can say is good luck!
author: Andrew T.

description:
I must admit that I wasn't a huge fan the first time I tried this spot but I've been going back so often now that I work so close by!

Strawberry Milk Bar with Creme Brulee topping is my favorite drink at the moment and I am a huge boba drinker so this says a lot. Without the creme brulee topping, it kinda tastes like strawberry milk so I recommend adding this topping if you like creme brulee. It's not too sweet!

I've also had the opportunity of trying every drink on the menu and they're all really good! I'm not a big fan of yuzu so that's my least favorite one on the menu but everything else is good and unique. You definitely can't find any other boba spot with such a unique menu and consistent drinks.

Definitely recommend trying this spot out!
author: Valerie T.

description:
Urban Ritual is probably one of the closest contenders to Boba Guys that I have tried. Perhaps it will take me a couple more trips to Urban Ritual to make my final decision, but I was thoroughly impressed by the quality, taste, and creativity of their drinks. 

I always do a bit of ig snooping before ordering at a new restaurant and was pretty much set on ordering the Creme Brulee drink that everyone raves about until my friend stopped me lol. So I decided to play it safe this time and try the Matcha Toffee with macadamia milk. I was so excited about my drink that I forgot to adjust my sweetness level and I was a bit concerned that it was going to be hella sweet. But surprisingly, it was just the right amount of sweetness. I really enjoyed the matcha flavor and it tasted super authentic. If you like crunchy things, you will enjoy the bits of toffee throughout your drink. The only thing that I didn't like was that their boba was a bit soft for my liking (maybe it's because I visited an hr before they closed...?). 

Overall, I like the creativity and their high-quality ingredients. Definitely give them a try if you have been curious about them.
author: Eva L.

description:
URBAN RITUAL!!!! Where have you been, all my (San Jose) life?!!

After months of looking at other peoples posts about this cafe, and drooling over the pictures, I finally planned an SF trip around Urban Ritual, and boy... it was worth every sip!

Here's an overview-

Pros:
1) The Creme Brûlée topping: Yes! This topping might as well be their best menu item. It pairs so well with their matcha and strawberry milk drinks etc. 
I recommend the Matcha with Toffee & Creme Brûlée, and the Strawberry Milk Bar (less sweet)
The drinks are a little pricey, but well worth it.
2) Milk Options: Regular Milk, Almond Milk, Soy Milk, and a couple other options for lactose intolerant or vegan customers.
3) Customer service: friendly, courteous, and knowledgeable 
4) Decor: Super cute. The cafe is a little small, but the decor is aesthetically pleasing.
5) They also serve Third Culture Bakery items; including the mocha muffins!

Cons:
1) Hard to find parking sometimes. Street parking can be a pain in SF.
2) No restrooms for customers. Get a strong bladder, I guess.

That being said, I'm glad I finally tried this cafe, and can't wait to visit them the next time I'm in SF.
author: Tushar S.

description:
If you're in the area and thirsty for some boba, bubble tea or a unique drink, head here!!!! You won't be disappointed at the selection, taste and atmosphere!

As a self proclaimed boba enthusiast, this shop definitely met my boba bar. A quick walk over from Hayes if you're already in the area. 

You'll love this boba place if you prefer your tea strong. I do and i found this place to be just about perfect. In addition to your regular milk tea flavors such as oolong and jasmine, they offer a variety of specialty drinks such as the matcha toffee, which is unique and delicious.

We ordered the honey oolong with honey boba and oat milk- and the tea was perfectly strong. Boba was sweet, chewy and soft. They adjust sugar levels and offer a variety of add ins including boba, jellies, and milk substitutes like pea and oat milk. (Tip: try oat milk for a creamier texture!).

The shop itself it neat, hip, clean and airy.

The servers are friendly, patient, and helpful! There is plenty of seating to hang out with friends. They also serve mochi muffins if you're looking for a bite to eat.

They are a member of the FiveStars rewards program so don't forget to punch in your number to earn rewards.

It's a little dark but it's surrounded by tall tall buildings. Parking is tough! 

No restrooms.

I'll be back here soon!
author: Karen H.

description:
Glad to have finally tried this place! I've seen so many of their outrageous drink combinations on instagram, such as their creme brûlée milk tea. 

I wanted something refreshing so I went for the Yuzu Green tea with 25% sugar. I didn't like the taste at first, since it was super bitter and sour from the yuzu, but after mixing it around a few times, I realized how good it tasted!

They also have Third Culture Bakery mochi muffins for those who have not tried them before, and a menu of set drinks as well as custom drinks.
author: Sandra S.

description:
No this wasn't a place I randomly stumbled upon. I purposely came to Urban Ritual to try their Matcha Toffee. I was not disappointed! I ordered it with regular sweetness. 

You pretty much get a piece of toffee with every sip, giving your matcha the right amount of sweetness. I liked the consistency of the boba. Wasn't too chewy, wasn't hard. 

There isn't much parking around the area - we parked a few blocks down and walked to it. The strawberry milk bar is a basic strawberry milk that I wouldn't recommend getting...just because it isn't anything special and you could probably make it at home. 

Creme Brulee, I'm eyeing you next.
author: Melanie B.

description: I prefer the creme brûlée over the matcha toffee. Obsessed actually. I get the torched sugar on the side. I like the unique drinks and quick service!
author: Tracy V.

description:
I finally made my way to this boba shop, not realizing it is on my way to and from work everyday! Then again, I guess it was a good thing I did not realize until now, or I would have definitely been making a detour at least 2-3 times a week to stop here for boba!

I love the small but brightly lit and minimally decorated cafe. They have an awesome assortment of air plants that I find super impressive as well. 
The menu is simple but unique, with flavors like BAE-sil and white grape oolong. I like that they have a few drinks for sampling at the counter, and I also really appreciated them letting me sample the crystal boba (agar based and crunchier than normal boba is how it was described) when I asked about that topping option. 

I ended up going with the white grape oolong milk tea at 30% sweetness with the honey boba, which I thought was a fantastic combination. Maybe the white grape was a little artificial, but I think it went very well with the aroma of the oolong, and the sweetness with perfect with the little bit of added sweetness from the boba. I will definitely be back to try some of their more drinks and will be keeping my eye out for more of their interesting flavors!

They also have third culture bakery mochi muffins, which were tasty but not enough to merit the $4 price tag. My friend had raved about it though, so I'm glad I got to give it a try. For those who do not like overly sweet pastries, the mochi muffin is definitely a great option.
author: Sherry L.

description:
Boba has certainly became a ritual for those in SF with a constant influx of trendy shops opening. I give it to Urban Ritual for their innovative concepts and living up to their name. 

I ordered the Creme Brulee through their FB messenger to get the $2 off, which is a promotion for them to test out mobile ordering similar to the Starbucks app. Hopefully, this eliminates the long lines. Their drinks are definitely on the pricier side for the regular size. It came with a little container of toffee bits taped on the cup, so they let you sprinkle on the topping. Innovative idea that definitely draws in the Instagram crowd. Drink itself was a little sweet and overpowered by all the toppings. Each sip you get a bit of crunch from the toffee, egg pudding, and boba. Boba had a smooth texture to it, but it leaned towards the chewier side. 

The shop is spacious, but there is still limited seating areas. The moment you walk in you can tell the owners are extremely attentive to detail with their design starting from their logo. The wall decor featuring an assortment of plants that matches the Hayes Valley vibe well. I would recommend this place if you are looking for a boba shop with unique drinks that you cannot find elsewhere especially when you are craving a refreshment that is not coffee in this district.
author: Ronald M.

description:
Very much a specialty boba shop. REALLY great drinks and everything is made in house with so much intention and love. I highly recommend all the specialty drinks (yes... I've tried almost all of them by now)

My favorite was the strawberry milk bar and I recommend this if you have a sweet tooth. My favorite tea based drink was the white yuzu! The great thing is that they have THREE DIFFERENT LACTOSE FREE MILKS! Oat, pea, and macadamia!! Heaven for a lactose intolerant person like me.

In a city with so many boba shops to choose from... this one is definitely worth your time and money!
author: Angelina H.

description:
What a great place to get some drinks after dinner.

You get massive discounts and deals using Fivestars and Yelp. Free topping and buy one get second 50% off.

Most of us got the Macha Toffee with boba which was recommended by the nice lady working there.

This place is small and gets busy very quickly. It has limited seats. Everything is relatively minimalistic. It's great
author: Tim C.

description: I had high expectations for this place because of all the instagram pictures I've seen from friends. I was surprisingly not interested in the drinks I thought I'd be into. I got the Strawberry Milk Bar and didn't love it. My cousin's got the creme brûlée and matcha toffee. The matcha toffee was alright, but the creme brûlée was sooooo good. The custard and the milk combo was surprisingly not too heavy and it's SO creamy. I didn't feel gross after that drink which is so surprising! The boba is also perfect. Urban Ritual over Boba Guys
author: Caitlyn S.

description:
Urban Ritual is a delicious specialty boba shop in Hayes Valley that is very much comparable to Boba Guys, but also quite different at the same time.

Not only is this place nicely decorated and quite Instagrammable, the drinks are good, too! My girlfriend and I ordered the matcha toffee latte and the creme brulee. 

The matcha toffee latte had fresh matcha in it and it wasn't too sweet, except for the crunchy bits of toffee at the bottom, which added a great texture to the smooth and creamy matcha latte.

The creme brulee has so much yummy pudding in it that each sip tastes like you're taking a bite out of a caramelized French dessert. The pudding is sweet and there are bits of real caramelized creme brulee in it to create a nice texture to the drink.

Overall, Urban Ritual is a great specialty boba shop and if you're looking to break free from the normal green teas and black teas and traditional toppings, I highly recommend giving this place a try!
author: Phillip V.

description:
I was so excited to finally check out Urban Ritual after all the rave reviews and Instagram shots I've been admiring for months.  

I arrived on a Tuesday around 4.  There were only a few drinks ahead of me.  I didn't notice that there were samples at the register, it was pushed more towards the side, so maybe something the cashiers could promote better.  I didn't discover this til I saw a few customers awhile after me sample and they were the drinks I ordered.  I ordered the Bae-Sil for myself and the strawberry milk bar for my husband.  I asked for a tray since I'd be carrying it back to him.  With boba my grand total $10.50.  The Bae-Sil is a strawberry lemonade with housemade strawberry syrup and lemonade topped with basil leaves.  The Strawberry Milk Bar is milk with strawberry syrup.  

For the prices they really should include loose leaf tea in all the drinks.  Why am I paying $5 for strawberry milk?!  After about 5-7 minutes my drinks were ready.  I'm not sure if they thought it would make it easier or if they were being cheap.  But when she handed me a tray she broke it in half because I only got two drinks.  Can someone tell me if this was supposed to make it easier for me to carry or was she just trying to repurpose the other half?  Both drinks had just the right amount of sweetness.  The Bae-Sil was nice and refreshing.  Perfect for a warm summer day.  The boba was just way too soft.  The Strawberry Milk has a nice not overly sweet strawberry milk flavor, but was a bit too faint.  It doesn't need to be in ur face sweetened with artificial flavors like Nesquik strawberry milk but for $5 give me more flavor and more things in my cup! 

For the price, and better flavors I'd stick with Boba Guys.  Urban Ritual is in a better Hayes location though and does take Five Stars.  I like how they have different offerings you won't find elsewhere, and offer alternatives for those not wanting tea.  But I think for the price again like for the creme brûlée and strawberry milk bar, include tea in it and offer it slightly cheaper for those who don't want tea in it.  IMO Urban Ritual is just a bit overhyped.  It's SF, there's better places.  2.5 stars.
author: Cat C.

description:
I'm not a boba guy. I used to be a bulbous guy. Probably from having too much boba before along with many other sources of calories. I heard this was the hot place to go for boba when I was sauntering through Hayes Valley on a recent evening. I was surprised and pleasantly relieved that there wasn't a line of Asian youth out the door, or as I like to call them...euthanasia. Otherwise I was worried that I had to dye my hair with motor oil to fit in. I have to admit I like the Chipotle approach of ordering here even if it challenges my small brain to track to the four steps I needed to follow.

Probably too self-conscious to wing it in front of the young server, I stood toward the side and studied the choices like an eye exam at the DMV. I liked the fact that no matter what I ordered, it was going to be $4.25. I decided on a Hibiscus Herbal Tea with Oat Milk and No Sweet. Oops, the oat milk cost me an extra fifty cents, and oh, adding the Honey Boba cost me another dollar (photo: http://bit.ly/2v61i2P). Damn. It's like Trump's destruction of Obamacare where he wants to nickel and dime me to an early grave. Tasty and I can actually sit down as I gird myself for euthanasia...I mean youth in Asia.

BUBBLE TEA - 4 stars...customized to my taste and I liked it
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...gee, it's nice when it's empty
SERVICE - 4 stars...she was patient and offered free samples probably because she figured out I shop at Costco like her grandpa
TOTAL - 4 stars...the Chipotle service model was a smart move here

RELATED - Collection of bubble tea shops I've tried and reviewed: http://bit.ly/2v4D7Sf
author: Ed U.

description:
Oftentimes, I go to places I see on Instagram with too high of expectations and am disappointed. Plot twist: Urban Ritual was NOT one of those times. 

Service: 5 stars. Warm, friendly, welcoming, and funny. Helpful and they let you sample cool flavors like their house milk tea ($4.25) and Whitegrape Yuzu ($4.75).

Tea: 4 stars. The honey boba was cooked to PERFECTION. It was chewy and sweet but not too sweet and with each chew I just kept thinking about the bursting of flavor even though it wasn't popping boba. I tried the Matcha Toffee which came out to $5.25 with boba and tax. Less sweet was sweet enough, especially with the toffee flavor which juxtaposed the creamy matcha by providing a pleasantly surprising chewy aspect.

There is little seating and there are NO bathrooms. My friend and I ran a block away to Biergarten and used the bathrooms there. If Urban Ritual wants to become the best boba place in the area (which it's shaping up to be) they really should add a bathroom.

I'll be back to try the creme brûlée tea and their matcha desserts!
author: Lizzie S.

description:
Solid 4 stars for their matcha milk toffee drink and good customer service.

They listened when I asked for it not too sweet, and were friendly with their samples.

They followed up by asking if I liked my drink, and seemed to be on top of their drink orders.

A great addition to the area.
author: Jack R.

description:
I love matcha, toffee and creme burlee. So when I saw a milk tea shop was serving these in drink form, I had to try! 

DRINKS: 
Okay, forget Boba Guys, because this place has so much more unique items to offer! In addition, the typical flavors, they have their specialty drinks!  
My friend and I ordered: 
+ Matcha Toffee $5: The drink was on the creamery side, matcha was strong and the toffee adds such a great crunchy texture to the drink and adds flavor too. I think this is one of my new favorite drinks   
+ Crème Burlee $5: Like a milk tea with egg custard chunks at the bottom. This drink could be on the sweeter side so I would suggest adjusting the sweetness especially if it already comes with custard. I believe this one also comes with toffee, which acts as the "burlee" part of the crème burlee. 

SERVICE: 
They have free samples! Staff there is very friendly and knowledgeable about their drinks. Service is quick too.

AMBIANCE: 
Pretty spacious interior for a boba shop! They have about 4 tables with plenty of lights. Unfortunately, they don't have bathrooms. 

Verdict: I would soooo come here often if it weren't so far from where I lived.
author: Samantha F.

description:
I'm obsessed with this place! I've been hearing so much about it so I thought I would finally give it a try. I can't really compare it to Boba Guys like I've seen these other reviews on here just because I think both places are different and has different style in their drinks/menu. 

What I got: The Jasmine milk tea with boba and creme brûlée pudding! THIS CREME BRULEE PUDDING IS SO ADDICTING. I've never had this before so it was definitely different and so refreshing , which is really hard to find these days since all boba shops are very similar now. I love how different this is and this definitely sets it apart from other places. 

The girl who took my order was also very knowledgeable about the menu which is also a plus because she recommended that I can get the creme brûlée pudding on the side instead of the actual creme brûlée special drink. Overall, I'll definitely be coming back ! 

PS. Parking in this area is horrible.
author: Tram N.

description:
Matcha Toffee? Crème Brulee? Strawberry Milk Bar?!

There is a new boba spot in Hayes Valley serving innovative speciality drinks and it is a must try!

Urban Ritual is located on the outskirts of Hayes Valley. The shop is small, but still spacious for a boba establishment in the city. Staff was friendly and atmosphere was welcoming.

Since this was my first time at Urban Ritual, I had to try several of their drinks. For starters, I had their Matcha Toffee (matcha green tea layered with classic milk and bite-sized housemade toffee brittle). I was blown away by the deep matcha flavoring. Also, I never imagined toffee would work so well with matcha!

Next, I had their Strawberry Milk Bar (classic milk with housemade strawberry syrup). I was looking the most forward to this drink and I was not disappointed. It was creamy and sweet, and reminded me of a strawberry milkshake. Can't be mad at that, right?

My boyfriend ordered the White Grape Yuzu (white grape oolong with yuzu honey). The flavors were subtle, not my personal favorite but it was refreshing! We also had the Crème Brulee (housemade crème brulee, honey boba, classic milk topped with crackling torched raw sugar). It was creamy and had hints of caramel. However, be warned that it is sweet. I recommend this to all my sweet tooth lovers out there.

Lastly, my boyfriend and I tried their House Milk Tea (house blend of black teas with house cream). Again, I was taken back by the roasted tea flavors. It was bitter and strong, but also creamy which helped balance it out.

All in all, I'm impressed by the quality of the drinks from Urban Ritual. It's a great addition to the Hayes Valley neighborhood!
author: Julia L.

description:
GET HONEY BOBA IN YOUR DRINK!! The flavor of the boba is definitely enhanced compared to nearby SF boba shops. 

THEY HAVE OAT MILK!! And their tea flavors are quite strong so it's good that they have a neutral dairy free alternative (soy milk always wrecks a good milk tea) 

VERY LITTLE SEATING INSIDE!! Idk why I'm yelling. Employees were nice, friendly. Right near the main Hayes Valley area. A little pricey too but well worth it for an occasional treat.
author: RachEl L.

description:
I got the jasmine milk tea and tried the house milk tea! I finished the jasmine milk tea so quick because it was so goood!!! It does get pretty sweet, so doing 50% or 80% sweetness is perfect. The house milk tea tastes like Hong Kong milk tea if you've ever had it. 

Price wise is on the more expensive side for milk tea, but it is in SF!! 

I love milk tea places where you can taste the tea, where the milk isn't too heavy or overpowering - Urban Ritual has it perfectly!
author: Ashli C.

description:
Very cute boba spot with great service! The cashier was very friendly: she greeted us when we walked in, offered us a sample of the Strawberry Milk Bar and White Grape Yuzu, and delivered my drink to where I was sitting. 

You can customize your own drink or choose one of their specialty drinks (that can also be customized). They also have different milk options that I typically don't see at other boba shops, like pea milk and oat milk! The Strawberry Milk Bar sample was good but I couldn't justify paying $5+ for what's essentially strawberry milk. I ordered the Matcha Toffee w/ less sweetness (30%) and went back to ask for a little more sweetness after I tasted it. I'm not sure how much she added but it ended up being too sweet for my liking. On another note, their homemade toffee was a nice addition to the drink and it complimented the matcha very well. 

Overall, the drinks they offer are unique and good but didn't have that wow factor for me.
author: Alika N.

description: They now have Grass Jelly topping as of 9/16/18. It's not sweetened so you don't have to worry about accounting for that when you decide on sweetness level.
author: Lily L.

description: Well, the drink is decent. I like the Afternoon Tea I ordered -  I enjoy the fragrance of the tea and right amount of sweetness. However, this space is really not ideal for study/work despite having several tables and chairs. There isn't a restroom! I felt that it's a bit misleading as there are tables and chairs encouraging customers to sit down and use free wifi but no restroom? I guess it's fine for people who just want to quick boba to go but for those who are looking for a place to study/work, this is not the place.
author: Phoebe T.

description:
Honestly this is a pretty cute boba place with unique and classic milk tea drinks! I could see myself coming back to this simple and sweet boba shop to try another drink. 

~matcha toffee (whole milk + honeyboba): I wanted to be adventurous and try out my favorite matcha tea with unexpected toffee bits. The matcha was great and the toffee was exactly what I expected. Crunchy, sweet and gets stuck in your teeth! It was okay at first but then it was a little too much! I would suggest getting a lower sweetness level because there is plenty of sweet toffee that will come up your straw

~White grape oolong (cream and regular sweetness 70%): light at first but probably needs some more vigorous mixing because it tastes more and more like sweet grape at the end 

My friend and I think the boba is pretty worth it to come back because it has a good texture and is nicely sweetened by the syrup. I do want to try the agar boba here if I come back next time. We do think it's a bit pricey for boba and our two drinks came out to be $10 exactly (5.25 for matcha and 4.75 for the oolong). If you come visit, be warned there is limited street parking
author: Katrine U.

description: Ordered creme brulee milk tea and it was really creamy. Its like drinking a dessert. Will try their matcha toffee next time.
author: Tracy F.

description: Absolutely the best place to get boba! I've been to many, if not most, of the places in SF and this is definitely my favorite. Urban ritual creates a lot of unique flavors and flare that really makes me love it. I love the creme brulee one because you can taste the creme brulee crisps as you drink it which is a very nice surprise! The employees are super nice and the place is very clean.
author: Christa L.

description:
On the outside it looks like a boba place run by non-Asians..LOL 

BUT! I was pleasantly surprised (inside it definitely has a vibe that could hold its own in LA where I currently live). The tea taste is very natural and strong. Had a sample of the honey oolong which was delicious so I got that at 0% sugar since 25% is normally a tad too sweet for me -- however, didn't take into account that their stuff is probably not as sweet as other places to begin with so unfortunately I played myself, but enjoyed the drink nonetheless. The boba itself was also the perfect amount of bounciness!
author: Shelley P.

description:
Mostly like this new boba spot.

Boba is super fresh, love the matcha toffee with bits of toffee sprinkled on top, love the free sample of their house milk tea...

Wished there was a stronger tea flavor though for their house milk tea. It was too milky. 

And it was weird that their regular sweetness is 70%. Like holy cavity, no thank you.
author: Mandi W.

description:
Came to Urban Ritual on a late Saturday afternoon and was disappointed that the store was out of Honey Boba. I guess I was fixated on the idea of how a boba shop can possibly run out of boba? I guess I'll have to come back again next time!

Ordered the famous Matcha Toffee (75% Sweetness) and it definitely did not disappoint! The Matcha drink had the perfect amount of sweetness and caffeine. The Toffee Bits in the drink was also a nice pleasant surprise and tasted delicious. It definitely will be my new to-go drinking when visiting this place.

I'm looking forward to visiting again to try other items on their menue including their Thai Tea, Milk Tea, and of course - their honey boba! :)
author: MyTien P.

description:
New favorite boba place in SF! I like their drinks, and the interior is super minimalistic.

Upon entering and reaching the counter, the friendly barista offered us some samples, since it was our first time visiting. We were able to try the house milk tea and the white grape yuzu (white grape oolong with yuzu honey). I quite liked the latter!

I ended up getting the house milk tea with pea milk (WHAT IS THAT?? I know, it was my first time hearing of such a thing when I walked into this store, but pea milk is kinda like soy milk) with the honey boba and 0% sweetness. I really like their boba, super soft and chewy. I like my drinks not sweet, so I'm glad they let you customize your levels. 

My friend got the creme brulee drink, and while we were both skeptical of it at first, we were satisfied with the drink. I would definitely recommend this drink for sweet tooths!
author: Tiffany H.

description: I was on the hunt for boba in SF and really wanted to go to Urban Ritual. It was a located in a cute little area with a lot of shops and the ambiance inside was really nice. The cashier was really friendly with her suggestions. I think she even gave us free samples of tea. The boba was fresh and chewy, not stale, and the tea was really flavorful and delicious. We got Earl Grey Hibiscus and March Green Tea, I think. Definitely worth the trip if you're close by.
author: Jessica A.

description:
I think I found my new favorite boba shop in the city (sorry Boba Guys and Asha)! I would dock off one star because this nice new shop does NOT have a restroom, but I can't because their tea was just too good and deserves 6 stars in the city, if possible!

For starters, I love the location of this shop, which is situated on a less busy street of Hayes Valley. The shop has limited seats (4-5 tables and a bench area by one side of the front windows), but does not get full or too loud, which is great for catching up with friends or with a good book in tow.

I love that they offered daily free samples at the counter the first time I went to try there and I fell in love with their Honey Oolong Milk Tea with Crystal (Agar) Boba. I loved the smoky and rich tea taste of the drink! Most boba shops dilute their teas with too much milk or do not brew their tea properly, if at all, but I could appreciate the full taste of the teas miraculously!

From the two tea flavors I tried that day, the tea definitely tastes freshly brewed and is definitely not from a powder, which I really do appreciate in a high quality boba shop that sells drinks for $5-6/cup. The portion size of their regular boba cup is comparable to those at Boba Guys and Asha Tea House, as is their baseline price point.

I am definitely coming back here to try more drinks from their very unique drinks menu, if not for their more traditional milk teas (I highly recommend their Honey Oolong if it is available)!!
author: Victoria W.

description: Maybe I'm just a sucker for strawberry syrup milk drinks, but I liked their strawberry tea bar quite a bit. The strawberry syrup tasted really fresh, and they added just the right amount to make the drink tasty without being sickeningly sweet. The boba was good but on the chewier side, and definitely less appealing to me than teaspoons new boba and probably boba guys boba. Will be back to try out their other stuff if I can bring myself to go back into the city.
author: Nevin L.

description:
Urban Ritual has become my daily Boba Ritual.

Jk, I'm not from the city, but if I was, then I'd love to go here like everyday. The matcha and creme brulee are as amazing as everyone says they are. I'm constantly craving the creme brulee because of the creaminess against the brulee's crunchy bits.

I was so against trying anything else because if I'm at Urban Ritual, I don't want to waste a moment where I could order my fave two drinks. However I ended up trying their "forever young" and no regrets, it was refreshing and tasty as ever too! Point being, order anything and you'll be happy.

ps: this is walking distance from a number of other businesses worth going to, like salt and straw! So great location to take a stroll (but crazy parking)!
author: Maleah M.

description:
Parking is awful

$4.75 ~ $5.25

Matcha toffee - delicious
Thai tea - mediocre, I'd recommend to skip
House milk tea (sample) - good
Bae-sil - this was good too but later on I didn't like the strawberry seeds at the bottom as you finish the drink so unsure I'd get it again
Strawberry milk bar - a liquid form of a strawberry smoothie, I'd recommend to skip
Early Gray Hibiscus - first couple sips were good but later became eh, don't think I'll get this again

I'll be back! still need to try a couple more drinks and will write an updated review
-------------------------
Creme Brulee - for the first time I think a product has too much milk haha I didn't like the caramelized sugar bite either but just per preference, overall the drink got too sweet for me

I'll stick with the Matcha toffee!
author: Yeanne L.

description:
Here is a hidden boba shop in the height valley where you cannot miss! I work in the Civic Center and whenever I crave for boba, Boba Guys is where I go.  Now I guess I find an alternative :p 

I ordered a matcha toffee which is one of their signature drinks on the menu. I usually order matcha drinks at every boba place I go and I can honestly say this is one of the most quality matcha boba I have in the city!  Love their toffee in my drink. I also like their White Grape Oolong milk tea & House Milk Tea.  Strong tea flavor even though with least sugar! 

Tips: Checked in yelp for one free topping :)
author: Shuyi L.

description:
The creme brûlée boba here is amazing!!!! I completely didn't expect this place to be five star worthy and thought the reviewers had gone crazy but he drink was amazing!

You can taste actual creme brulee in it, along with the crispy sweet pieces from the top of a normal brûlée. The whole thing was just flat out amazing and very enjoyable, from the sweet tasting honey boba, to the excellently crafted cream.

Great choice and an amazing surprise!
author: Tyler T.

description:
Why'd you move to SF? Because of places like Urban Ritual.

Coming from the Midwest, land of nothing Asian, I feel like I'm in heaven with the abundance of bubble tea. I went from having one choice to having to research 20 minutes on which place to visit next.

Usually, I don't venture to Hayes Valley because I don't want to walk a mile plus. However, this is so worth the walk! The neighborhood is popping with restaurants, coffee shops, young professionals, and more. You have many other reasons to make the trip over here although Urban Ritual is enough for me.

The inside is everything simple. And the staff offers free samples! It's great if you aren't a big oolong tea drinker but want to see if this place brews it better. I came in torn on what to order and ended up getting the Creme Brulee. Yeah, it was on the more expensive side but I don't know where else I'd find a drink like this.

The drink surprised me since I read reviews prior. I have a sweet tooth which could be the reason why, but I was hoping it would be sweeter. Don't get me wrong, I loved it and the sugary bits but I wouldn't have minded them making it extra sweet. For the lactose intolerant friends out there, they have alternatives so you can experience the deliciousness too! 

I'm still a bit new in all of SF's bubble tea spots, but this ranks superior thus far. Next, I'll have to see if Boba Guys can compete and live up to the famous reputation. If not, I'll be back to try the strawberry and matcha drinks!
author: Brandon S.

description:
After seeing the reviews on Yelp, I was pretty excited to try this out. While the rating is low, it really comes at the caveat that I didn't like my drink. I can definitely imagine other people enjoying it more than I do but my personal preference says otherwise. 

That said, I ordered the creme brûlée and it was decent. I would say there are some minor adjustments that could be made that could really skyrocket the quality of this drink in my opinion. First there's the torched raw sugar that's supposed to mimic the top of a creme brûlée. While in theory it makes a lot of sense and the sweetness levels for this drink were in a good range, the raw sugar could have been a little more flat. What I mean is the torched sugar was more like little cubes that added an odd texture to the drink. 

I didn't like the crunchy raw sugar that got stuck to the teeth and then getting a well made boba. It felt contradictory. Personally don't think the boba fits into the drink that well and could be excluded and added if desired. Also, if the raw sugar was more like the top of a creme brûlée where the sugar was like a thin film that was broken apart I would have enjoyed that much more. It's such a small change but it really made me wish it was the case so I can have one of my favorite desserts in liquid form. 

Other than those minor complaints this place is a nice little chic place. The decor is bright with ample lighting. There isn't a whole lot of seating, maybe enough for 12 or so people so come prepared but there is a small park nearby if the weather permits. Overall pleased, service was good and drinks were quick despite a line building up. 

TL;DR Creme brûlée is decent but minor changes to the raw sugar cubes and option to add the boba would make the drink a true liquid creme brûlée
author: Ryan F.

description:
I hate to break all the 5 star reviews, but Urban Ritual is just decent in my opinion. Great service, some unique offerings, but not enough strong tea flavor for me. 

Location wise, parking seems tough. My brother managed to squeeze into a spot after I moved a sign further back, hehe....

The menu consists of earl gray, jasmine, oolong, and regular black milk tea. Sweetness is customizable from 30%, 70%, to 100%. Also, free samples available!

FYI: There are nondairy options-pea milk and oat milk. I tried the oat milk sample and it wasn't bad. 

I ordered the matcha toffee 30% sweet and it was okay. Toffee was sprinkled on top for an interesting texture, and it wasn't overly sweet. I probably wouldn't reorder. My brother got the earl gray milk tea, and he said it was okay too. He used to be a Starbucks barista, and he's made something similar at home.

Prices are up to $5 if you want boba in it. 

Overall, I'm not super impressed. Wouldn't go out of my way to try it, but if it's around I would give it another shot.
author: Corinna T.

description:
Wanted so much to like this since it had great reviews and the idea of a creme brulee tea drink sounded awesome!

They definitely have a great variety of drinks and a bunch of innovative options, but I wouldn't say that this is my go-to tea spot since the drinks costs ~$6 each and were extremely sweet. This may be a great place to stop by and split a tea after a date or hang out.

Don't bother looking for parking around the block but if you're willing to walk it seems like there are spots a few blocks away!
author: Andrew T.

description: Ugh.. I didn't want to like the creme brulee milk tea but I can't keep living this lie. The milk tea combined with creme brulee pudding, boba, and burnt sugar.. omg. That drink is like diabetes in a cup and I just can't quit it.
author: Stephany L.

description:
One of the best drinks I've ever had.
Creme brulee drink was so good.
The creme brulee pudding in the drink was very creamy but tasted just like a regular creme brulee. The sugar in the drink added good texture to the drink to. 
The boba texture was nice and chewy just the way I like it.
I want to go back again and try more drinks especially the matcha toffee.
Make sure to tip your servers they have really amazing customer service
author: Erin S.

description:
Recently, I was at a new restaurant and was asked for our feedback. We gave it (nothing bad, we said that the food was too salty) and it got really awkward. Like booger hanging out of my nose, awkward. They obviously weren't receptive to the feedback but at least we tried.  

San Francisco is brutal grounds for small businesses owners so if you have enough balls to open a business, you have to BRING it. The first impression is the only and lasting impression. Some get it and some don't. Obviously, that business didn't so good luck to them. 

Right afterwards, we visited Urban Ritual and was wow'd by the customer service. Ok, these guys get it - they're really bringing it and it's reflected in their raving Yelp reviews that look legit. 

While there's hundreds of places that sell boba milk tea in SF, Urban Ritual is unlike most of the mediocre boba shops in SF. Their craft tea concoctions are unique and made from top-notch ingredients. You can actually taste the tea unlike most places that serve watered down iced milk. 

On the menu are their Signature Drinks ($4.75) and their Everyday Classics ($4.25) where you can customize your own drink with a particular tea, milk option, sweetness level, and toppings (+.50). Love that they offer two non-dairy options for the lactose intolerant: pea milk and oat milk (+.50) and caffeine free options. They also have free samples. Handful of tables for seating.  

Including the two samples offered that day, I've tried the following (most fav to least fav): https://bit.ly/2jZF3FW

*Bae-Sil: Strawberry Basil Lemonade w/ housmade strawberry syrup, basil, and lemon (sample): Incredibly refreshing and a perfect thirst quencher on a warm day. 

*House Milk Tea: Housemade blend of black tea w/ house cream (sample): Deliciously creamy and milky with good tea flavor and roasted notes. I love roasted oolong milk tea so this is something I will find myself ordering regularly. 

*Whitegrape Yuzu: Whitegrape Oolong w/ yuzu honey ($4.75 + .50 cents for lychee jelly): This was my co-worker's drink which she loved and after trying several sips, I can see why. Prominent tea flavor with great floral, sweet grape, and citrus notes.
 
*Strawberry Milk Bar: Classic Milk w/ housemade strawberry syrup ($4.75). Growing up, I loved Nesquik's Strawberry Milk so this was nostalgic but I wished there was more strawberry flavor. 

*Crème Brulee: Housemade Crème Brulee w/ classic milk, crackling torched sugar, no boba, sub oat milk ($5.75): Ok, ok...I know this is one of their most popular drinks but I'm not a dessert person so not really my style. It does taste like a crème brulee in drink form (not too sweet as promised by the owner) and I thought the crackling sugar perfectly emulated the caramelized sugar crown in the classic dessert. If you're a fan of pudding in your milk tea, you will like this. I gave it to my boss who LOVED it. 

Service is most excellent and the owner(s) are VERY customer oriented. Think In-N-Out and Happy Lemon but more personalized. They even bid us goodbye by name. I've been working in the same office with the same people for years and I still don't know half their names so that's impressive. 

As much as I love Boba Guys in Hayes Valley, it's nice to have another great option for high-quality milk teas near work!
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
I heard a lot of good things about this place and decided to visit with my friend. We ordered the Strawberry Tea Bar and Afternoon Tea.

Overall, the store is close to Hayes Valley and it's impossible to miss. The service was great, and the place was very spacious with tons of seating for studying. 

I felt as the flavors of the drinks weren't as strong as I would like but definitely worth the try.
author: Jeffrey C.

description:
I came here with my boba-loving friend to try out this cute little tea shop even though it was freezing outside. We ordered the caramel brulee tea boba and the earl grey hibiscus tea with boba. The earl grey hibiscus was just ok--I didn't feel like the flavor balance was there for me since there was a lot of hibiscus. The caramel brulee tea with boba was really decadent and actually tasted like the dessert itself! The milky tea was sweet and there were little cracked pieces of caramelized sugar at the bottom along with the boba. I enjoyed a few sips of this but ultimately it's really sweet so I probably wouldn't drink the whole thing.

Overall, this place is cute but really known for their signature drinks! As a non-milk drinker, I was a little disappointed that I couldn't just order a passionfruit green tea with boba. I'd recommend if you're really into sweet drinks and milk teas since it's probably the best boba place in Hayes Valley.
author: Megan K.

description:
This may be a bold claim, but after my first visit, I can already say that Urban Ritual is better than Boba Guys.

The service is amazing. Upon walking in, the cashier (who may have also been the owner) greeted us and offered us samples. He also did a great job at recommending drinks. We walked in knowing we wanted to try the Creme Brûlée Milk Tea because of the reviews on yelp, but he also recommended the Matcha Toffee. 

Both drinks were delicious. Not too sweet, and the boba was tender. I've had my fair share of boba, but both of these drinks were really unique. 

The atmosphere is also really great. If you like early 2000s hip hop/ R&B, this is the place to be. 

I'll definitely be coming back when I visit SF again!

Instagram: @jhaseats
author: Jhasmyne D.

description:
Urban Ritual is one of my top favorite places for boba.  They overtook Boba Guys for me.  Why?  It's cause of their crystal boba.  Regular boba just isn't the same for me anymore.

My go-to drink is the Earl grey black tea with pea milk at 30% sweet.  The perfect sweetness and still able to taste the high quality tea.  I do have to dock a star.  $5.25 is just a tad too much for boba sometimes.
author: Karen L.

description:
The unique menu got me here. Once there, the service was on point. My friend and I walked in and were immediately greeted. We spoke with the staff throughout our visit and they really sound like they care about the business and its products. 

They had two bottles for samples in the counter -House Milk Tea and Forever Young {Sangria (not really sangria, but called that for its color) w/ elderflower cordial, lemon, & berries}. Both were good. I love that there were samples. I went there with the intention of trying the house milk tea for my first drink because, well... I need to try the basics before jumping into other flavors when I try a new place. 

With that out of the way, I moved on to Creme Brûlée (house made creme brûlée, honey boba, classic milk tea topped w/ crackling torched raw sugar). This was amazing. The different flavors went really well together. It's sweeter than I normally go for, but it was yummy nonetheless. (My friend got the Matcha Toffee, which I got to try... yum!!)

I'll be back. I need to try the other flavors!!
author: Lani S.

description:
This is one of the newer boba spots that opened up in the city.  Parking is a cluster here so public transportation or your own two legs would be best.  I've seen multiple businesses come and go at this exact location.  I am hoping that Urban Ritual is here to stay!

The place is super clean.  Once you walk in, you're greeted with smiles and samples.  We always order one house milk tea with boba as a comparison to other competitors.  This one did not disappoint.  I loved that I could actually taste the tea!  What???  Is that even a thing nowadays?  They also sweetened my drink perfectly at 30%.  

As for the other drink, we got jasmine milk tea, no milk, and boba.  Loved it.  For me, less is more and I could definitely taste the quality here.  My only one issue was that the boba was just a tad overcooked.  Once it loses some of its chew, it gets to the mush real quick.

Next time, I'll give the matcha toffee a try.  Oh, and yes, it's better than boba guys.
author: Jen W.

description:
My coworkers and I paid Urban Ritual a visit after I saw their pictures on instagram recently. When we got there, someone was passing out samples! Samples are always a good way to entice anyone in :D

Urban Ritual has classic drinks as well as more creative drinks on their menu. My coworkers and I ordered the creme brulee drink and the matcha toffee drink. I got the creme brulee because I love the dessert. It came with homemade torched sugar, creme brulee, and honey boba for $4.75. At first sip, I thought the torched sugar bits were a little weird, but they definitely grew on me and I found myself stirring the drink up to make sure I got all of them! I also liked the clouds of creme brulee floating around. It really made the drink taste like an authentic creme brulee. I tried my coworkers matcha toffee drink and that was pretty yummy too. 

Since it's close by my work, I would love to come here more often. I'll probably switch off between here and Boba Guys, lol!
author: Tara A.

description:
Woot! Urban Ritual finally relocated from their temporary location to their official location at Hayes Valley. Definitely more difficult to find parking and it's right along the busy intersection of the neighborhood. So don't drive by too fast or else you'll miss it. 

As usual, the matcha latte here is superb! The taste is really rich with the matcha flavor. You can always ask to hold off the toffee bits (a little hard to bite). 

The creme brûlée is handmade at their store so you know it's going to be fantastic. Again, there will be bits due to the caramelization of the creme brûlée. I believe it's difficult for the baristas to hold off on that so just a heads up! 

The strawberry milk bar tastes like the strawberry milk that Koreans are selling in LA! Kind of tastes like a strawberry milkshake/ice cream. Pretty sweet drink if you're craving for something refreshing on the fruity side. 

The afternoon tea is such a bummer for me. It's a mixture of earl grey milk tea with cocoa powder to be their version of chocolate milk. But I honestly think they should have kept it at as an earl grey drink because the cocoa powder is too bitter and grainy. :/
author: Sarah F.

description:
Date & Time:  Friday May 4, 2018 @ 5:30pm
Boba Date:  The Husband
Scene:  Guys in All Black & Girls in Floral or Blush Spring Dresses w/ Aquazzura Slide Sandals
Decor:  Urban Boba Shop w/ Subway Tiles & Reclaimed Wood.  Bench Seating & Tables for Two
Service:  Hot Boba Guy Offered Us Macarons and We're Like "Nooo, we have to save our calories for boba".  He laughs and says "Me too, that's why I haven't had one yet".  I Think in my Head You Seriously have Nothing to Worry About.  I Get the Feeling he is Only Around for the Opening- Abercrombie & Fitch wants their Model Back
Imbibe:  Strawberry Milk Bar, Grape Yuzu, Creme Brûlée w/ Boba.  Love that They have Non-Caffeinated Drinks as I have Given Up Caffeine for Years Now- Yes, I'm Naturally Like This
Total:  $15.50
Note:  May the 4th Be with You
author: Genevieve Y.

description: I know that a lot of my coworkers constantly order their popular drinks here, so after having it bookmarked for quite some time and hearing them tell me how great it is, I finally decided to go last weekend. My friend ordered the one that they were sampling on that day and I went ahead and ordered the strawberry milk bar. TBH, mine was just was eh... I definitely feel like Boba Guys Strawberry rice milk is 10 times better. Don't get me wrong, I'm sure their popular drinks that everyone always gets here are great because my friend's drink was good, I just didn't know why I felt adventurous that day and strayed away from what I intended to come here to order-- which was the matcha drink with toffee bits on the top. But I mean I definitely will go back and give it one more shot
author: Mey H.

description: First time here and i love it! I got the strawberry milk bar less sweet and my friend for the matcha. The place is clean and aesthetic with good vibes.
author: Andrea K.

description:
Pretty lazy today since it's a Sunday and I'd rather continue sleeping than write a long review. 

But to sum up my review: I live a few blocks down and I can say that I will walk to Urban Ritual instead of Boba Guys because 1) I know the lines will be shorter 2) the boba is just as good, if not better and 3 ) I like supporting small businesses. 

You need to try this place. Seriously - so good.
author: Emily F.

description:
Not bad.

What I tried: 
*House milk tea 
*Strawberry milk bar w/ boba
*Matcha Toffee 

Overall thoughts: 
*House milk tea is not that sweet if you order the regular sweet 

*Boba has a good chew and some sweetness but again not very sweet 

*Strawberry milk bar was yummy! I love the real fruit bits

*Located in a cute little spot with tables, seating and restaurants nearby
author: Sarah W.

description:
New modern boba place alert in SF! 

My friends kept talking about this place and their toffee matcha drink, so I finally trekked my way out of the suburbs to try this place. Since it's located in Hayes Valley, it's kind of a pain to get to in the city unless you uber or muni from Bart.

At first glance, the interior is clean and modern. They have a light wood aesthetic going on and a few small tables for customers to sit and enjoy their drinks.

I ended up getting the pretty Toffee Matcha drink everyone was talking about. It was a surprisingly good combo. They put crushed toffee bits on the top of the drink that swirls in when you drink it. It kind of makes it taste like an Almond Roca candy bar, mellowed out a bit by the matcha. It is pretty sweet with the addition of toffee, so I would opt for a lower sugar level next time. Their boba was also perfectly chewy. 

They have a couple cool features on the menu including the fact that you can pay a bit extra for oat milk in your milk tea. I think that I would totally come back again to try other drinks! But in terms of location, it is kind of out of my way--I think I would often opt for Boba Guys because I find them comparable, but Boba Guys shops are easier/more convenient to get to.
author: Clarissa C.

description:
Ehhhhh.

Okay, dont get me wrong.  This place is super cute.  As cute if not more cute than all the hype I've seen on instagram.  Plus it smells great in there and the service is so friendly, even 15 minutes to closing.  The honey boba was sweet and soft, and my house milk tea was good.  Good.  Not amazing.  Not life changing.  The tea flavor was a good amount, but only with my first few sips.  Once my "less ice" melted away, my drink tasted pretty watered down.   I would come back to Urban Ritual if I was in the area.  However, street parking can be quite crazy in this area, and there is a Boba Guys a few streets away...
author: Kim C.

description:
My part two of Urban Ritual takes me to Fell St of Hayes Valley, where almost no stores and restaurants are located.  I'm pretty sure there are other potential bubble tea lovers out there who are yet to find this nifty bubble tea shop.  The smell of Urban Ritual is the same smell from other bubble tea shops I used to be in.  No line when I come here in the early evening, and the seating was almost full of patrons.  Just another day in bubble tea paradise.

In Urban Ritual, pretty straightforward, customize my cup of ice cold tea with pea milk as my favorite non-dairy creamer.  I choose honey oolong, honey boba, 30% sweet, and once again, no ice.  As I got myself a customized milk tea boba, I looked very closely in the plastic cup.  My sense of humor, a light haze billowing from the black pearls!  Now that's my kind of PEA-spective in a cup.  As I sip through the whole cup, I like the lightness of the milk tea compared to the heavy thickness of the cow's milk blended into the tea.

Customer service turned out friendly in Urban Ritual.  I would definitely be back if I'm in a mood for milk tea.  I'll be looking forward to seeing if there will be any further changes in the menu items. :-)
author: Jimmy C.

description:
Right when you walk in there is a nice aroma and a friendly greeting from one of the staff.  This is cozy place to kick back and go on the internet or hang with someone while drinking some tea.  Well, when you manage to find parking (I recommend taking public transportation or else you'll be waiting forever to find one).  

I heard about this place on Yelp, and after looking at all the good reviews there I thought it would live up to the taste.  Never before have a ever been so disappointed in boba tea before.  I got the Matcha Toffee and Creme Brulee, which was okay.  The looks were good, but the taste didn't live up to expectations or the price.  I usually like matcha stuff by this was just not up to snuff.  It would have been better if it a stronger matcha taste and if the toffee bits were a little smaller.  They were big and couldn't be sucked up the straw.  The Creme Brulee was definitely better.  The boba was pretty good (this being said from a person that doesn't like boba).  It is made fresh there so this came out soft and hot.  There is also a pudding and sugar that makes it sweet but not too sweet.  Although, the goodness of the Creme Brulee milk tea doesn't outway the priceyness or the disappointing taste of the Matcha Toffee.  Very likely not going here again.
author: Arianna C.

description:
Amazing and a must go to boba place if you are a boba lover! Their drinks are absolutely amazing. I tried the creme brûlée milk tea and they different options to substitute the dairy--since I am lactose intolerant--and you can sample any substitute if you're unsure. 

This place is right Hayes Valley so it's perfect for just ordering your drinks, and then going shopping at the stores afterwards.
author: Melinda W.

description:
Came here on a Sunday night before closing to have a drinks tasting since my friend @FlavorFullSF on Instagram got invited to try the flavors, we were also invited to join her. Big props to the store manager, David for giving us exceptional service - we couldn't decide what to try, so he offered everything on the menu, even their seasonal secret menu drinks! They have 12 different drinks total including the 2 seasonal drinks, but you can put together your own as well. I will list my top favorites of the menu:

- Strawberry Milk Bar: tastes like the ice cream bars and boy was it delicious, especially when you mix it with the creme brulee topping (additional $1)
- Forever Young: sangria made with elderflower, lemon & berries - very refreshing and doesn't have the alcohol aspect of sangria. 
- Bae-Sil: Also a great refreshing fruit option if that's what you're feeling. Not too sweet and very light in the basil flavor vs the strawberry, which I liked. 
- Matcha Toffee: Matcha was a good flavor, but the toffee bits is what stole the show. I enjoy chewing on the bits along with the matcha flavored drink.
- House Milk Tea: I feel like every boba spot should have this drink perfected and it was solid here at Urban Ritual. Not too sweet, and good mix with the boba.
- Creme Brulee: My mom would love the bits of sugar from the torched part of creme brulee, but the drink tastes so much like creme brulee, that I would definitely order when I'm craving. This is a must-try if you're a creme brulee fan. 

The two secret drinks for this season:

- Hot Chocolate Hojicha: tastes all like dark chococlate hot cocoa and none of hojicha. Very heavy on the chocolate, a little too thick for me, but not too bad in chocolate flavor, just wish I tasted more of the Hojicha part.
- Pumpkin Chai: not a fan of chai, and after tasting, the pumpkin flavor lacks  and is overpowered by thai flavor.


Would recommend checking it out, but parking isn't the easiest. Cute decor of airplants and wooden furniture.
author: Amanda C.

description:
I have had multiple people tell me to check out Urban Ritual, and I was finally able to! I was honestly surprised by how small their menu is because I'm used to boba stores having so many options that it's such a struggle for an indecisive person like me to make a choice. However, Urban Ritual has some unique flavors! They had some samples there to help you decide as well. 

We got 3 flavors - the House Milk Tea, Bae-sil, and Creme Brulee. The House Milk Tea was alright. We got it with less sweetness, so it had more of a tea taste, which I enjoyed. The Bae-sil is perfectly refreshing for a warm day. It reminded me of strawberry lemonade but minus the sourness and with a hint of basil. The boba was tasty too - probably one of my favorite places for their boba. It had a good texture. Finally, the Creme Brulee! It was probably my favorite drink of the 3. It even comes with pieces of creme brulee. However, after a while, it gets kind of heavy and too sweet, so I would probably get a lower sweetness level.

Overall, I'll definitely be back to try the other flavors and maybe to study because the vibe was nice.
author: Samantha L.

description:
You know that person that's very good looking, and extremely nice, but there's just no substance to them beyond that? That's what the experience at Urban Ritual is like.

The drinks are beautiful AF. They stay open on major holidays (July 4th). But their tea be watered down, yo.


There's always the chance they could change over time right?
author: Stephanie B.

description: Be careful with the hot drinks. I ordered hot drinks twice but the cup leaks everytime
author: Ivan H.

description:
I wasn't drunk this time; so I was Clear enough to ask for suggestions for something that was a lot sweeter than the House Milk Tea and found it in the Creme Brulee, settings untouched.

A good amount of seating here and seemingly a nice space to spend your lunch break or arrange a casual meet-up over boba.

They have outlets along the wall next to the tables so work here to your heart's content or just chill till your next Lyft arrives and you're on to the next tapas bar.
author: Jason A.

description:
Been here a couple places now. Their house milk tea and matcha are both delicious. The boba is always a good consistency- fresh. Gets kind of pricey, but with Boba Guys charging similar prices, it's not a surprise.

They have interesting dairy substitutions (oat/pea milk). There's a good amount of seating in here, it's normally pretty quiet. Staff is super friendly and they always have some teas out for you to try.

Definitely worth a visit if you are in the neighborhood!
author: Arezou A.

description: Aesthetic venue to enjoy boba with friends. The registrar was very genuine based on her efforts to remember your name. I ordered the Matcha Toffee which was quite the surprise. The drink was pretty decent in addition to the toffee crumble texture. However, I highly recommend the strawberry milk tea! It is smoothest beverage of strawberry delight. Keep an eye on this booming business!
author: Michael D.

description:
Been wanting to try this place! 
Was in the area and told my hubz to drop by so I can get a drink. Yeah don't even try to look for parking unless you're feeling super lucky that day.

Anyways, he dropped me off to get the drinks as he circles around the busy block on a Sunday -- I ordered the Matcha toffee latte with oatmilk and boba. The boba could be better but it's chewy (a bit bland but most places are -- except for half and half in LA). But the toffee made it better... omg so good! Finished my drink before we got to SF costco.

Hubs got the Earl grey Hibiscus; maybe because he was taking sips off my drink so he didn't enjoy his drink as much. LOL -- Should always go to boba place for what they're known for imo. :) 

Will possibly try the creme brulee drink next time but i tend to stick with what I know and I know the Matcha Toffee is bomb. So it's a yay!
author: Kady S.

description:
Boba...do you love me? Are you Riding?
Say you'll never ever leave from beside me 
'Cause I want ya , and I need ya 
And I'm Down for you ALWAYS.......

(if you get the reference you can be on my team. Give my profile a follow to follow my great SF Bay area foodie adventures). 

Except for this last time (Sorry regular Milk tea) ...since I had to switch it up with something different.

So I've already tried their regular milk tea with boba which is good.  I have them at a 6/6 on my 10/10 milk tea taste/boba taste scale for the regular milk tea which are both above my "avg" 5/5 score. This places them #12 of 54 spots in the SF/Daly City area which is the upper tier.

So for the regular milk tea alone I don't think I'd go here. Thanks  to a yelp friend I went and tried the Matcha Green Tea with Toffee and although I'm not a Matcha fan per se  this drink was actually pretty darn good. I would recommend getting that over the standard milk tea (because I think other places do standard milk tea better).  

So to review: MATCHA TEA with TOFFEE is THE SIGNATURE DRINK HERE!!!! 

The toffee (which in general I'm not a huge fan of either) compliments the flavor of the Matcha Green Tea surprisingly well. 

The service also here is among the best in the city. Super friendly and I like the layout of the new store. I'm glad they have a spot after their success at the pop up at the poke spot a few miles away. 


Rod M tours San Francisco area in search of the BEST standard milk tea with boba. I have individual reviews for all the places listed below.  I have a more comprehensive Tiered Bay Area boba list 125 boba spots and counting. 

I recently embarked on a completely pointless quest to rank most of the Milk Tea/Boba Places in the area.

Rules: I ordered a simple milk tea with Boba (regular sweetness, ice etc.)

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #51  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

Rod Boba SF Rating = (Taste of Milk Tea / Taste of Tapioca Balls) on a Scale of 1 to 10 (10/10) being the best score possible

* Please note that I like my boba a little bit sweet. I don't like it too milky, too strong of a tea taste or too watery.  I prefer fresh tasting larger "boba".
