Powdery drinks (those places that simply have a plastic carafe that they pour out of ) and boba that tastes "old" get docked on my rating scale.  A place could have a higher Yelp rating than it's boba score would imply , if it sells things other than Boba that are good. 

Boba SF/Daly City Rankings:
1 Itea  2 Cool Tea   3 The Boba Shop  4 Little Sweet  5 Good Earth Café  6 Hanlin Tea 7 Caffe Central   8 Puppy bobar  9 Keep it  10 Wondertea  11 Enter the Café  12 Urban Ritual  13 Tpumps  14 The Ramen Bar  15 Eightea  16 Super Cue  17 Bliss Sweet  18 Enter the Café  19 BB Tea Station  20 Qualitea  21 Steap (not Steep)  22 Bubblecup  23 Tea Hut  24 Sharetea  25 Tanca  26 Boba Guys  27 Steep (not Steap)  28 Mr. & Mrs. Tea House  29 T&T Café  30 Pit Stop Boba Shop  31 Bobo Drinks & Pho  32 Samovar Tea  33 5 sweets  34 TJ Cups  35 Asha Tea House  36 E Tea  37 Kestourine Macarons  38 Little Heaven Deli  39 Maggies Café  40 Belly Good Café & Crepes  41 Tea Bear  42 Sweet Heart Café  43 Honeycreme  44 Elixiria  45 Quickly  46 Plentea  47 Honey B Tea House  48 Sweethut  49 Mi-tea  50 Ten Ren Tea  51 Wonderful Foods/Dessert & Café  52 Out the Door  53 I Café  54 Phusion  
                                                 
Just a little taste of my greater Bay Area Tiers is below (there are 6 tiers I have in total, I've reviewed over 124 + boba spots now but obviously not enough room to list them all here) 

124 boba spots and counting in the Bay Area (yes you read that correctly one hundred and twenty four ...) 

Rod's SF Bay Area Boba Tiers: This is based on my milk tea taste/ boba taste rating scale with 10/10 being the absolute best.  I have actual ranked lists for the South 880 corridor and San Francisco in case you're wondering. 

Tier 1 (Alphabetized) "Magnificent 4" aka "I'll get some even if I shouldn't..."
Bubbly, I-Tea, Pekoe, Teatop

Tier 2 : (Alphabetized) "The Almost Elite..but not quite" aka " I'm a fan but not a die hard" 
Caffe Central, Cool Tea, Factory Tea Bar, Good Earth Café,  Gong Cha, Hanlin Tea, Little Sweet, Passion  T snacks and Desserts, Soyful Desserts,  Tea Station ,The Boba Shop, U Cha 

Tier 3 (Alphabetized)  "The Above average spots" aka " Sure why not..let's roll" : 85 Degree, BlackBall Desserts, Bliss Sweet, Bobapia, Cha Express, Che-Lo, Keep it,Puppy Bobar, Qualitea,  Super Cue, T4, Tastea, Tata Tea,Tea Breeze,  Tea Island, Tea Six,  Tea Station, Teaspoon, Teatime, The Ramen Bar, T-Lab, Tpumps,Urban Ritual, Wondertea
author: Rod M.

description:
Super glad I got to try this place out; it's been on my bookmarks since it opened! Parking is usually pretty difficult over in Hayes Valley, but I was able to snag a metered spot after circling once. Phew

When I came in on Saturday around 4pm, 2/3 of the tables were filled. In the front, there were samples of the White Grape Yuzu and Afternoon Tea. The White Grape Yuzu was a super refreshing drink and you can definitely taste the oolong tea. It gets 5 stars from me. The Afternoon Tea tasted like chocolate milk. 

The cashier was super patient and very knowledgable. I loved her recommendation of the Bae-sil. It definitely hit the spot for me. With boba added to it, the drink was $5.25 (16 oz). The boba was very soft and chewy and had a hint of sweetness to it. They give you good amount of boba. At the end of my drink, I probably had 6-8 boba balls left. 

I also took a sip of my friend's House Milk Tea. The tea flavor wasn't very strong unfortunately =/ It was just decent milk tea. Their other drinks were a lot better. 

Overall, this is now added to my list of angela-approved boba shops!
author: Angela W.

description: Usually all bubble tea places get five stars from me because I just like boba that much, but the lychee toppings were way too small that you don't get the texture when drinking. I liked the honey boba, but the crunchy/sweet toppings in my boba were unnecessary and sickly sweet. My 30% sweet matcha was also sweeter than expected.
author: Alice Z.

description:
Yelp 100 Challenge 2018
44/100

Saw all the good Yelp reviews and had to visit!

Workers are SUPER friendly and accomodating. They'll explain all the details and offer you some samples as well~

Personally wasn't a fan of the yuzhu tea, but their matcha toffee is a MUST TRY!!!! So SO good. 

The bits of toffee just add sweetness to the matcha~
author: Stacy A.

description:
Urban Ritual is a cute new tea shop on the outskirts of Hayes, ironically not far from Boba Guys. They serve a limited menu of tea drinks and only one size (16 oz), but I really liked the matcha - nearly as good as Boba Guys and unique because they top it with toffee. I thought it was good but a strange sensation to drink liquid mixed with crunchy hard toffee bits.

Overall, recommend as a place to visit for boba fiends because the boba was sweet and squishy, the teas were strong, and I really liked my matcha and the black milk tea! Will be back to try some of their other concoctions.
author: Jess C.

description:
Matcha toffee! I ordered it without any modifications. It's so good, I personally wouldn't add any other toppings since the toffee already gives your drink texture. 

My friend ordered the matcha toffee made with oat milk and creme brûlée topping which was also good but there was just too much texture going on in your mouth after awhile. 

The yuzu drink my other friend got was also delicious if you're looking for something more refreshing. It's great paired with litchi jelly. 

They have a few small tables in the store, or you could take your drinks and walk about a block down and sit outside.
author: Stephanie L.

description: I think the matcha tea with toffee is the signature drink in store and it is creative and tasty. Recommend it!
author: Christine Z.

description:
I came here for lunch one day and there was no line, yay! Probably because it is a little hidden and not much people know about this place yet. 

Once I came in, the guy at the cashier was very friendly and welcoming. He gave me a sample of the Forever Young and some drink suggestions. The Forever Young drink was refreshing, but a little bit sour for me (it has lemon in it, so I wouldn't be surprised). I decided to go with the White Grape Yuzu which is white grape oolong with yuzu honey because I wanted to get something that sounded refreshing and juicy, but not too sweet. This was the perfect drink for me because it was exactly what I was feeling like having that day. I liked how it wasn't too sweet, yet flavorful and refreshing and did not taste syrupy.The service was great and he also offered to adjust the drink to my liking if I didn't like it. There are many other drinks on the menu that I'd like to try so I will definitely be back. It is a bit of a walk from work, but I'll be sure to drop by again if I feel like I need a walk!
author: Bailey L.

description:
Love how this place adds a little twist to regular milk teas!
My favorite has to be the toffee matcha.
Legit matcha latte + chewy boba + bits of crunchy sweet toffee = new fav drink.
author: Erika L.

description:
Boba is probably my most frequently used keyword in the Yelp bar. So lo and behold, I found myself at Urban Ritual after searching for alternative boba options in a Boba Guys dominated neighborhood. 

The place was empty on a Friday afternoon and I walked up to a cashier who immediately offered me the samples for Strawberry Milkbar and Forever Young. The strawberry milk was no Nesquick--it was sugary, creamy, and tasty. For a sweet tooth like me, the cashier highly recommended the creme brûlée (which came with boba!) so I had to go with that. And although I was initially skeptical about the hard sugar bits and toffee in their drinks, as is similar with their matcha toffee drink, I was immediately converted after one sip. This place has original drink flavors, sweet boba, and great service. Would highly recommend!
author: Jessica E.

description:
Pretty good!!!
The toffee matcha was great.
I liked the bits of toffee - great crunch.

Will be a big boba brand soon. Comparable to boba guys, but no oat milk :(
author: Nabiha J.

description:
Awesome new boba place!  I love that their drinks have a strong tea flavor and isn't overwhelmed by milk and sugar. The boba is also warm and perfectly chewy. Possibly my new favorite boba place in SF! 

MATCHA WITH TOFFEE BITS - amazing! I thought the toffee bits would be too sweet and pair weirdly with matcha but the combination works surprisingly well. I would get the drink slightly less sweet since the toffee bits are already sweet.

WHITE GRAPE YUZU - this drink is SO GOOD. You can taste all the individual flavors - grape, yuzu, oolong. It's super refreshing and a great option if you like a stronger tea profile since the fruit flavors aren't overpowering.

I usually get less sugar for all my drinks but since this place doesn't overdo it, I would get regular for most drinks. Highly recommend!
author: Angela P.

description:
I tried out this boba place because a friend recommended it. Great service! Fast and friendly. The walk from civic center bart station is about 15 min (a good workout but not too far). The shop is small, clean, with minimalistic decor. It's great for instagram pics. 

Flavor tried: matcha toffee w/ boba & creme brulée. The matcha could have been a little stronger in flavor, but i still enjoyed the mix of milk and matcha. The toffee sprinkled on top added a nice crunchy texture. The creme brulée (don't stir in, leave it as is on the bottom) made the drink more creamy and sweet. 

P.s. these pics are featuring my boba socks!!
author: Romelyn Q.

description: Place is located on the outskirts of Hayes Valley. Staff is friendly. Tried the creme brûlée and matcha drink. Sampled the grape tea and enjoyed that a lot. My friends all like the creme brûlée drink but I personally prefer the matcha one. Tried the creme brûlée with the toffee topping rather than the sugar the second time I visited (prefer that much more than the sugar bits; too sweet). I think next time I'm going to get the matcha and add the creme brûlée topping. Also, looking forward to trying the strawberry milk. Glad there's another boba place by work!
author: Tina S.

description:
I ordered the Match Toffee and my boyfriend ordered the creme brulee so I got to try both. 

The Matcha Toffee was by far one of the best Matcha drinks I've had (probably in my top 3 matcha drinks). I had mine with whole milk but I know they offer other milks such as oats. The drink isn't too sweet nor too bitter. This place offers a well amount of matcha in the drink and it tastes very much like real matcha! It is so good and flavorful...I think this specific drink may turn into a craving of mine someday! Lol! The toffee by the way is crumbled on top of the drink. 

The Creme Brûlée drink is also very good! I'm glad I tried it from my boyfriend because I'm not someone who would lean towards this drink. But overall it was actually good! Make sure to mix it well so you can taste the flavor other than the milk. 

Both drinks we ordered had honey boba. The boba is by far the BEST boba I had. It is very soft and pretty warm which means that it is very fresh. 

The inside of the cafe is very modern and cute. There's a lot of chairs and about 3-4 tables. I would come here to study or do some work because it's not very noisy down there. 

Overall, I recommend this place if you're in the area! Such a cute neighborhood and offers great drinks.
author: Angelina G.

description:
This place definitely deserves 5 stars!!

My bf and I came here on a Sunday afternoon and were offered samples of the House milk tea and the forever young, which is a sangria with elderflower cordial, lemon, and berries. The milk tea was good, not too sweet, and the forever young was super refreshing! 

My bf liked the forever young so much that he ordered one for himself, but note that you can't adjust the sweetness level for this drink. That shouldn't be a problem though since this drink isn't overwhelmingly sweet. I ordered the matcha toffee with oat milk and 70% sweet, which is Urban's regular level of sweetness. It was my first time trying oat milk and it was surprisingly reallly good. The toffee gives the drink some texture and a hint of sweetness, which I love--- it spices up the drink! My bf isn't a huge fan of matcha, but he actually really enjoyed my drink. 10/10, totally recommend both drinks!! 

I was reading reviews for Urban Ritual as we were waiting for our drinks and a few people mentioned that this place is better than Boba Guys, which to some may seem like a bold statement, but I have to agree. Quality drinks, samples, no line, and they even bring your drink out to you??? What else could you ask for, honestly!! 

Can't wait to come back and try their other drinks (or order the same one over and over). Support your local small businesses!!!
author: Jennifer L.

description: This is a great coffee place in the Mission! They have a lot of coffee variety and also food. It's a nice space and plenty of room to meet friends or get a table to work.
author: Catherine L.

description: Our new addiction...I feel guilty ordering the matcha toffee, but do it anyway ha. Friendly service, made quick and everything we've tried is delicious. The location is a little difficult to get to if you're driving, but if you don't mind parking a few blocks away and hoofing it a little, we've been pretty lucky. I'm tempted to try some of the things in the case, but everytime we arrive its in the evening so I'm always curious if they're still good or not. The boba is too soft for my counterpart, but I like the chewiness so to each their own. I'll see you soon, probably after dinner sometime :)
author: Guisela L.

description: The best boba shop in SF, hands down! Literally, when we first walked in, we were greeted with such friendly welcomes ! Assuming that the guy who worked there was the owner, he was surely the most attentive individual I've ever met! While we were placing our orders, he recommended us to try their samples, and gave really good suggestions upon what to order ! Anyways, we ordered the house milk tea with honey boba and the matcha toffee! They were both amazing drinks! Definitely will come back and try their other drinks ! Honestly, I can't get over the amazing customer service that we received!
author: Shirley G.

description: The place is unique for sure! Their creme brulee boba is fantastic. The flavor was an excellent choice that really makes this boba shop different from many others! The pudding inside was phenomenal and of course the boba had perfect chewing texture. Seating is decent and is perfect for a quick hangout/stop. Come througgghhh
author: Jason Y.

description: Great boba place! I ordered house milk tea with honey boba, 70% sweetness and it came out in less than 5 minutes. It wasn't too sweet and the boba wasn't too chewy or soft. The interior is very minimalistic and simple - my only problem is that there isn't a whole lot of seating. Also it's kind of pricey for boba since the house milk tea was $4.75 and if you wanted toppings you needed to pay an extra $0.5.
author: Emily P.

description: New bubble tea place in the neighborhood. Compared to other bubble tea places with dozens of menu items, they have a few drinks that they specialize in a la the boba guys model. There are some interesting menu items like their creme brûlée drink. On my visit I got the matcha milk tea and it was delicious and the boba was perfectly cooked to be the right texture where it's a bit chewy. I also got to try their house milk tea and that one was really good as well with a strong tea favor. Friendly service and seating available.
author: Jenny J.

description: Omg! I love this place! Because of my dietary restrictions I can't have milk teas. But I love how you can substitute milk with pea milk and oat milk. We ordered the white grape yuzu and the creme brûlée with pea milk. I loved loved loved the creme brûlée. It's creamy and sweet and the bits of sugar is a nice touch. Watch out boba guys, you have some competition.
author: Windy M.

description:
A solid alternative to the ever busy Boba Guys. The boba was good, but probably needed to be soaked in the syrup for longer after cooking.

Tried the creme brulee drink and a matcha milk tea. The creme brulee drink is definitely a nice idea, and worth trying. The matcha milk tea was nothing special and tastes like pretty much every other one.

Waiting for this place to grow up with large sized drinks, slightly less confused staff, and ideally a restroom as well so it can earn the full 5 stars!
author: Alfonso C.

description:
First timer, I tried their Matcha Toffee with 30% sweetness. It was good, but I wish they had low-fat milk as option. I wonder why boba places never think of this? People will drink more milk tea if it's less calories.

The place seems brand new, nice & clean. However there are not many tables, especially if you came to hangout in big groups. There are 3-4 two seater tables on one side of the wall and couple long benches (with no tables) on the opposite wall by the entrance door. 

I sat there until I finished my drink & noticed their WiFi wasn't really working (on & off). Maybe they don't really want you to hangout? Such typical Asian joint, sadly.

Minus another star for not having restroom. C'mon, really?! Where do your employees go? I guess they want to save on cleaning & supplies expenses?

You could do better!
author: C K.

description:
Cute little place in Hayes. My friend who I was staying at's place is nearby so I was super excited to try it out.

We ordered House Milk Tea (regular), Afternoon Tea (lowest sweetness) and the matcha cupcake. 

Probably one of the closest contenders to Boba Guys in SF and Tea Era in Mountain View. Pretty great quality, taste, and creativity for drinks!
author: Rebecca H.

description: This place was terrible, not really sure what the hype here is. I got the White Grape Yuzu which is pretty pricey for tea already. The tea itself was bitter and the flavors were just not very synergistic. All in all, given Boba Guys is only a few blocks down, I'd much rather just go there rather than coming here. This reminds me of a South Bay casual milk tea shop with SF prices. Not a fan.
author: Jasmine X.

description: Really cute hipster boba place. We had the Matcha Toffee with agar boba (based on the barista's recommendation, but I think the drink would've gone better with honey boba) and the Creme Brulee, which came with boba. I really like that they have interesting drinks, and the drinks themselves were pretty good, but too sweet for my taste (even the boba, and I rarely think the actual boba balls are too sweet!) and they were ~$6 which is pretty pricy, considering they weren't big drinks.
author: Alice C.

description:
TL;DR - Yummy drinks that are amazing quality!

Normally I'm not really into super sweet drinks (I'm one of those black coffee drinkers). BUT the drinks at Urban Ritual may have changed my mind. 

Must trys
- Matcha Toffee (I got this with added pudding and it was delicious)
- Creme Brulee

The best part is that the drinks can all be made DAIRY FREE. YUUUUUUSSSS.

I'm not a daily boa drinker, but this place is definitely worth the random treat-yoself kinda thing.
author: Crystal Z.

description:
I like to watch my sugar when drinking drinks, but with my first time here, I thought, why not! Let's try the Creme Brulee drink!

It wasn't as sweet as I thought, and very rich, heavy, and creamy (whole milk). I got the crushed sugar on the side in a container and found that I didn't even put it in my drink at all. The drink was perfect amount of sweetness and was very think. I wanted to dilute it a bit, and add more ice to make it colder, as it reached room temp pretty fast. The boba was great, and they put a lot in there. Although great, I probably wouldn't get it again, because it felt like I was drinking like a meal replacement or something, it was so heavy!!! I wish it was a bit lighter and more refreshing (with more ice), so it didn't feel so thick. Other than that, I can't wait to come back and try their Honey Oolong :) 

Much better than Boba Guys.
author: Hanna M.

description: The atmosphere of urban ritual was absolutely refreshing. It was very modern and quiet, and the chemistry of the workers also contributed to the warm environment. It's relatively big and you can see the process in which they make your drinks so that was another added bonus. The menu was limited but all very high quality. For a drink, it's a little bit pricey (5-6?) but overall, i think it's very worth it if you're looking for a little "treat yourself" day. The matcha toffee was very good (with Boba guys grade matcha and toffee bits that added a nice crunch but wasn't overbearing) and I got the white grape oolong with lychee jelly. I was surprised at how much of the white grape i tasted and the lychee added to the sweetness of the tea. Will definitely revisit this place!
author: Maya S.

description:
I finally got a chance to try this place out. I am pleased to say, I am happy I did. I tried the Creme Brulee which was delectable. It had the right amount of sweetness, the boba was  made just right, and it had a generous amount of bits of creme brulee. This drink is perfect for someone like me, who loves milk tea and creme brulee. I will be back to try the other specialty drinks.

Customer service was excellent and they bring the drinks to you. 

The place is clean. There are seating options to fit your mood, tables and chairs or benches.

They have Fivestars, so I will be back to earn my points!
author: Lyric A.

description: Never thought hibiscus tea and milk tea would be a good combo , but it was delightful and refreshing! Excited to come back and try the Bae-sil
author: Joanna R.

description:
If you do not serve hot tea, please do not say yes when taking the order, only to turn around a make a snide remark how you do not actually serve hot tea after you give me the wrong drink.

Backstory: I came in wanting a hot hibiscus tea, since it was their only non-caffeinated drink on the menu. No addons, no nothing. Person at the counter says sure thing, takes the order and charges me - all good so far. 3 minutes later (yes, that's a pretty good turnaround time) I have an iced tea in my hands. 
Looking a little bit surprised, I mentioned that I asked for hot tea. To which the reply was something along the lines - oh we don't make that here. 
Well thank you so much for providing me with the complete opposite drink of what I wanted.
author: Vali C.

description:
I fell in love with the matcha toffee at their pop up shop and I'm so glad they have a permanent location now because I will literally follow them wherever they go! The toffee is not overly sweet, doesn't stick to your teeth, and has just the right amount of crunch without being hard and brittle. It's so hard to describe because I've never had anything like it. They have such unique drinks that no other boba shop has. 

Also the customer service is amazing! They are so nice and accommodating, and I love when they have samples out!
author: Lily Z.

description:
AMAZING!!! My new favorite boba spot!! I've been around all of the Bay's boba places, I've worked at a boba place, AND I'm Taiwanese so my judgment is pretty sound if I do say so myself!! I have zero issues with this place! They have more creative drinks and they are done super well. Yenno, sometimes stores like to experiment but aren't always successful, but this place is solid. Worth the steeper price compared to the average boba shop.

FOOD (dranks)
YUMMMMM. The Creme Brûlée ($5.25) is SO worth the price. It's milk, creme brûlée (flan), burnt sugar chunks, boba, and milk. When it's fresh the creme brûlée is still warm MMM. It cools down over time and still stays tasty. The ratio of toppings to drink is a little big but I don't have a problem with extra chewiness after the drink. I got 50 sweet no ice which was perfect to taste all the flavors equally. 

I also got the Matcha Toffee w/ boba ($4.75+0.50 topping). It's a matcha milk with the same burnt sugar chunks they use in the creme brûlée. The matcha is smooth which is awesome bc some boba places have issues with matcha being grainy. The matcha flavor itself was just okay, wasn't *super* aromatic like Asha.

MOOD
Spankin' clean store. The barista stations are out in the open and also look really tidy. Super trendy and cozy design choices which I love. There were a ton of young students here on laptops when I came, it's a solid working spot with outlets too. 

'TUDE
Both employees I interacted with were very attentive, patient, and friendly! The cashier patiently explained each drink I asked about and really made me feel like he was trying to curate the best experience for me.
author: Jocelyn S.

description:
Honestly, one of the better boba places that I've tried in the Bay! My favorite in SF is still Boba Guys, but Urban Ritual isn't bad at all. Their menu is smaller compared to some other place I've been to, but I would say it's still a good selection of teas/fruity flavors/etc. Something for everyone. (You can also build your own drink as well!)

I tried the House Milk Tea (usually my go-to if I'm at a new boba place) and loved it! The tea was strong and flavorful, just the right enough of milkiness, and their boba is chewy and sweet! (I hate boba that isn't sweetened and clearly isn't freshly made.)

I can't wait to come back here again and try some of their other flavors!
author: Carole Y.

description: came because of all the hype from Instagram! My friend ordered the creme brûlée specialty drink but it was a tad bit too sweet. I ordered the matcha green tea with classic milk, 70% sugar, and honey boba. it was pretty basic but I think the milk from boba guys tastes better.
author: Samantha C.

description:
Check out the new boba shop on -Fell St, had the "match toffee "and "forever young". 

Highly recommend the match toffee , it is interesting to have crunch toffee as a topping Especially while I am chewing the soft and chewy boba and crunch toffee at the same time.

Will come back and try the "afternoon tea". Sounds classic.
author: Eva T.

description:
If you could look past the horrible parking that SF tends to provide, and occasionally long lines within the store, you'll begin to see that this place has one of the best dessert drinks hands down. 

Ordered the Crem Brûlée tea with whole milk and it was incredibly delicious. Texture was creamy, crunchy and sweetness was the perfect amount. Ambiance-wise, they have a pretty nice backdrop near inside the corner where you can take some IG worthy photo ops. Would definitely come here again.
author: Huy N.

description:
Hmm... This place is okay.

Granted, I got something basic (the milk green tea), I didn't think anything was anything special. I'm not really sure what it was (I don't think I'm that picky about my boba/milk tea) but this just wasn't that good.

I also tried some of the creme brulee milk tea, but that too was okay. I loved the concept but ultimately I wasn't a fan of the sugar chunks.
author: Brandon L.

description: My fav boba place in the city, approved by Taiwanese! My favorite flavors are cream brûlée, it tastes just like real cream brûlée with honey boba, the best dessert drink ever! Matcha is also good highly recommended!! Must try!!'
author: Kathie F.

description: I got the matcha toffee boba and it tasted a little too sweet and creamy for my liking. But that could also just be because I generally order purely tea based bobas without milk. The toffee sprinkles on the top gave a nice crunch and overall, the drink is very unique (though heavy, almost as if it's filled with cream instead of ie. milk). I could understand why people like it though.
author: Charmaine L.

description: I really enjoyed my matcha toffee tea and Churro bread pudding. Not the biggest fan of the lychee jelly. Love that they are open late and will be back !
author: Aiden O.

description: Parking is difficult in this area. I heard about this new boba shop from my friends so I decided to check it out today. Inside the store was very spacious and tons of tables and chairs if you want to hang out and have a chit chat with your friends. Friendly staffs and they also provide samples for you to try. Also put in your phone number if I you want to collect points and get a free drink after 10 points I believe. I got the crime brûlée drink since the cashier said it was their top seller along with matcha toffee. I also got the bae-sil for my boyfriend. He loved his drink because it tasted like an non alcoholic mojito. I was very satisfied with my drink as well because the boba were chewy enough and it was just the right amount of sweet. Definitely would come back and try the rest of the menu.
author: Tina C.

description: This coffee shop is on point. First time coming here and was NOT disappointed. Food and drinks are great! My favorite is their drink Creme brûlée. They also serve Third Culture Bakery Pastries. Fast service. Would definitely recommend!
author: Mobi S.

description:
I thought that the boba was a bit over priced but maybe that is average for the area? I'm not from SF so I'm used to a lot cheaper pricing for boba even the "fancier" boba places. I ordered the matcha toffee and honestly wasn't a fan of the toffee bits in my drink it gave it a weird crunch. The matcha drink itself was good.

The place overall looks nice but hated that they didn't have a restroom. Having driven 2 hours from another city to this spot you'd expect them to at least have a restroom for customers. But nope they said sorry no "public restroom" even after tipping the cashier. (If I could I would definitely would have taken back that tip.) By the way I brought my little one with me (she's 1 years) who needed a diaper change. Could have been that customer who changed their children right in front of everyone but of course I didn't.
author: Valerie L.

description: Another Instagram worthy boba place. They have super flavorful selections and bobaristas with the kindness to accommodate all of your weird alterations and needs. The drinks are a little pricey though. I don't think I should be paying $6 for a drink.
author: Calvin H.

description: Not mind blowing but I still liked it! The tea and the service is good. This would probably be my go to place if I wanted tea in San Francisco.
author: Lanny N.

description: I came in here not knowing that this is not a basic boba shop and thought they had taro milk tea, Jasmine milk green, Thai tea, etc but they don't because this place has unique drinks ! Their menu has less than ten options and mainly consists of strawberry flavored drinks, crème brûlée, their version of regularly milk tea, basil strawberry drink, and a honey drink. I ordered the basil strawberry drink and it was so good cause they use actual strawberries !!!!! My friend ordered the milk tea and it taste like chocolate milk lol. The server/ cashier was really nice and served the drink to us which is something I don't ever see at a boba shop so that was super sweet of her ! I can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu
author: Katy W.

description:
Pretty decent
Boba is chewy
Service is 
Nice atmosphere and setting
They let you try out the flavors which is very unusual for boba places but it was nice to try out
author: Arthur K.

description:
I loved the wooden interior of the place. The atmosphere was extremely calming. There was a cute urban ritual / tea decor hanging on the wall. (Perfect for a photo!) 

[Creme Brulee Boba] I have never had creme brûlée before this, but it tasted amazing in boba form. There were literally chunks of creme brûlée floating in the drink. I loved the hardened pieces of caramel that miraculously didn't clog up the straw!

[Sangria Tea with Crystal Boba] I loved the refreshing, fruity quality of the drink. The crystal boba was very chewy and popped in your mouth.
author: Annie Z.

description: The creme brulee milk tea is really good, even though it is more on the pricier side and the most expensive thing on their menu. But I would say its worth the price! Has creme brulee at the bottom of the drink, and bits of sugar that give it a nice, extra crunch! Boba was really good too! The staff are super nice, they always offer you samples, and even walk over to your table to give you your drink!
author: Nicole S.

description: We got earl grey black tea with cream 30% sweet with honey boba.  Customer service is really good, the tea didn't have a strong flavor.  The boba was really good though, sweet and chewy.
author: Irene M.

description: I would say give the drinks a try, but wasn't the biggest fan of the strawberry milk drink. It wasn't THAT much better than a Nesquick strawberry milk, so I felt it wasn't worth it. The boba (+50 cents) was delicious and chewy though. Drink price was a bit steep ($5.25) for a 16oz drink. My friend loved the creme brûlée drink ($5.75 w/ macadamia milk and included boba). Some seats available, and they have Fivestar, which is great considering Boba Guys doesn't have a reward system in place.
author: Thomas L.

description:
We took an urban hike to get to urban ritual. Came here to try the infamous matcha toffee and it was delicious. The matcha flavor was pronounced but not bitter. The toffee bits were crunchy, sweet, and salty treats whenever you got some in your mouth. They complimented the matcha pretty well. Regular sweetness works for the matcha toffee, especially because the toffee brittle introduces some extra sweetness.
We also ordered the white grape yuzu. I liked the yuzu honey. The grape oolong was not very strong, but maybe that's the nature of the tea. I might go up to 100% sweetness for this drink if I order it again.
We added honey boba to both drinks. Their boba is pretty soft and slightly chewy. The honey is pretty subtle. They were still warm from just being made.
If they have samples out, be sure to try them to get an idea of their regular sweetness level because urban ritual definitely tones down their sweetness. The sample of the basil lemonade was good - something I might come back to order.
author: Christine L.

description: loved drinking the succulent hot tea!! :-) :-) :) yummmmmmmmmmmmm mmmmmmmmm mmmmmm mmm mm mmmm mmmmmmm mm mmmmmm mmmm mmm mm mmmm mm mmmmm mmmmm mmmmmmmmmm mmm mmmm mmmmm mmmmmmmm mmmmmmmmmmm m mmmmmmmmm mmmmmm
author: Jenny B.

description: Got the creme brulee. Was super good. Has like a melted carmel and toffee crunch. $5.25
author: Victoria C.

description:
I rate this place 6/5 stars! One of the best drink i have had since moving to the bay area. There are a good combination of drinks you can make but their specialties are really good. I got the strawberry milk and it was amazing.

You may first think the price is a little high but the flavors will not disappoint you. The tea is good.

The staff is very friendly including the owner. I would definitely go here again.
author: Duy T.

description: muffin was super dry. &cold Thai place down the street has way better boba. Horrible managing.
author: Ice P.

description:
Awesome drinks!!

You can really taste the tea in each drink (unlike some other boba places), and there's a lot of options for milk substitutes. I tried pea milk for the first time with my honey oolong tea and loved it. 

Not many places to sit, but you could always walk to the outdoor park on Octavia which is nearby.
author: Jenny M.

description: Amazing tea and boba! Boba is perfect and loved the sangria berry tea. Only problem really is the cups are too small! Probably 16oz no large option  please get bigger cups!!!
author: J D.

description: This place is just what we wanted! They have a wide variety of choices and have a lot of dairy free options. The flavors are classic but also they have a lot of flavors with new interesting twists! The staff is incredibly kind and it is located in such a cute area! If I could recommend one thing from there it would be the chrysanthemum tea, it was delicious! Highly recommend and will absolutely come back here again!
author: Ashley M.

description:
i just found the place 
on yelp ads.and then directly go !
i wanted to try Cream Brulee with boba!it was new flavor and now added my favorite creamy ,yummy boba tea!this is very clean place in hayesvalley
author: Tokibox 6.

description: Drinks were bomb! I ordered the matcha  toffee, taste exactly how it sounds, delicious. Definitely would come back to try their other teas.
author: Kenny L.

description: I got the hibiscus tea with honey boba. I got my drink very quickly and the employees were all super sweet and kind. The cashier gave us two types of teas to try before we ordered and was patient while we made our decisions. I'll definitely be back!
author: Aditi S.

description:
I tried their Creme Brulee & man....it was so delicious! I love that they have samples of their drinks for you to try. When I was there, they had the Strawberry Milk & Muscat/grape Oolong thingie? (forgot the name) which was both really good. I'll prolly get that next time I'm back. 

The boba was soft in the beginning, but later on, with the coldness from my drink, it got "hard" just a tad bit more which made it perfect! It was the right mix of chewy-ness and bite to it, but soft too? IDK how to word it, but it's how I think boba should be. My boba never got hard because of the ice & IT'S A BIG PLUS because there are places where the boba will get hard after while from the ice.
author: Amy V.

description:
Hands down the best boba in the city. I've tried the matcha with toffee in it so far, with honey boba added. So delicious.

They make their own burnt sugar in-house (for the creme brûlée drink), and have pea and oat milk in addition to their delicious regular creamy milk. 

I haven't tasted a better boba consistency before.

Seriously, before you go get a super sugary drink from Boba Guys, come here!
author: Dani B.

description:
I was extremely excited to try out this place but unfortunately, it was just  a-ok. I'm glad I tried the creme brulee boba - it's so creamy and sweet, it'd actually be a pretty delectable dessert for two, but I don't think I'll crave it so much to return. My boyfriend ordered the Classic Milk Tea, which was good but their honey boba was a bit too big and chewy. 

I'll say they definitely have a really unique menu with milk substitutions such as pea milk and oat milk. However, as a person that just doesn't like food/drinks that are too sweet, their drinks weren't really for me.
author: Joanna H.

description:
I'm so glad that Urban Ritual moved to Hayes Valley. Before, it would take me 40 minutes to commute by bus, but now it only takes me 15 minutes! I find myself constantly craving the creme brûlée drink, I love creme brûlée as a dessert, but as a drink it's just soooo much better!! The boba is always soft and chewy, just the way I like it. I also loveeeee the Matcha Toffee drink too, the toffee bits adds that unique flavor to the typical matcha latte drinks and I love the crunch! This place is my go to boba spot in the city! 

Drink recommendations:
Creme Brûlée 
Matcha Toffee
Bae-sil (fruity and refreshing)
author: Tran N.

description:
This is the place for some milk tea or refreshing drinks! I love their " forever young "! It's a must try! 
So refreshing mmmmm! David is the man btw for making those awesome drinks!
author: Jason L.

description: I identify as a bobaholic and I wasn't a huge fan of my drink. Sure 2 stars might be rough but I honestly cannot say that I enjoyed the experience.
author: Joshua F.

description:
I am a big fan of boba milk tea. Growing up have milk tea and had tried many places. So, as a disclaimer, I might have a slightly picky taste. 

Visited here twice. I like that they provide samples for you to try first. However, there is inconsistency in their milk tea. 

The first time I visited, the sample for honey oolong was very good. I was impressed so I immediately ordered one honey oolong. The one I got from the order was disappointing. The sample I tried was a 5 out of five points scale, but the actual milk tea I got was like a 3. My friend did exactly the same thing and got a much less than the sample version milk tea.

I visited the second time thinking giving it another try. As I said before, the sample I tried the first time was pretty impressive, and I would love to have that. However, it's still not so good the second time.

I would say that their milk tea quality isn't consistent. I hope one day they could make it always good. (Then I would come back)

I would give it a four but have to minus one star for the fact that as a milk tea shop they don't provide a restroom for their customers. :(
author: Xiaorong Z.

description:
Nice little shop on Fell street near Laguna. 
Very interesting flavors. I have tried the matcha toffee and the grape yuzu, and the strawberry bae-sil... all delicious!! Have to come back and try all the flavors!!
author: lovetoeat a.

description:
Wow - the Creme Brûlée milk tea is so YUMMY! Bought it for my toddler b/c it's decaf... took a sip of it and WOW - so darn good. I had their house milk tea and it's great too. It's usually my "go to" boba drink; but I think I've discovered a new FAV.

Super glad I finally got to try this place out. It is sooo good. They've pretty much nailed it as their boba texture is perfect. They are chewy with just the right about of bounce.

Will definitely be back again (soon) b/c I know I'll be dreaming of the Creme Brûlée milk tea tonight
author: Emme F.

description: My friends recommended this place and since they're natives, I decided to try Urban Ritual. The place has the ambience of a coffee shop and a welcoming vibe. I ordered the matcha toffee because I love matcha and never had toffee in it before. When I got the drink, at first, I thought they had put crushed nuts on top of the drink. After tasting it though, I could definitely tell it was toffee, which added a nice sweet crunch to the drink. The matcha was smooth and not too sweet!
author: Nathan C.

description:
Walked over from Van Ness station. Urban Ritual is kinda close to the freeway exit so parking may be difficult.

Coming in, there are tables against the walls and straight ahead is cashier and menu. 

I got to try out samples when I was looking over the menu. I ended up ordering the creme brûlée and it was creme brûlée indeed . The drink was very sweet ( I actually don't need extra sugar) with the boba, custard , and the crispy caramel all mixed together. I liked how it changed my drink texture. 

I didn't see too many outlets but the WiFi was decent. Need to come back to try more drinks
author: Brenda B.

description: Stopped by this new tapioca joint on the hayes valley today (glad that they finally have tapioca in the neighborhood). The gal behind the counter was super friendly answering all the questions my friend and I had. She was so patient with me and even let me tried their homemade toffee topping which was very delicious. Based on the tapioca I tend to like she helped me make a decision for make your own. The honey boba was very tender and sweet and the consistency was just right. I loved the green tea I had and when I was on my way out they had milk tea samples. Milk tea was actually really tasty! Maybe I'll get that next time. The only reason it's not 5 stars is because they don't have a lot of variety yet but I know they're new still so will probably add some more items in the future.
author: Yvonne L.

description: Creme brulee boba is the bombdotcom!!!!! Everything about it is perfection. And this preorder pick up is amazing. Good job!
author: Gessa C.

description: The milk tea is good! And if you're too far away from Boba Guys - this is the place to get your matcha fix on. It's quite good. It's fun to get the boba here and walk around Hayes Valley.
author: Jenna L.

description: Even though the boba was a little undercooked for my preferences, I don't think it's enough to deter me from coming back. This place exudes quality (interior is also clean and modern). They let you sample two of their teas by the cashier which just goes to show that they're using real tea (crazy that this is now a plus for boba tea shops). I really liked the honey oolong that I sampled; I could taste the tea flavor but the honey added the extra bit of sweetness that made it super delicious. I ended up getting the strawberry milk bar, which had a strong and refreshing flavor. I really enjoyed it. I'll definitely be back when I'm in the area to try their other drinks!
author: Sharon W.

description: I had the strawberry lemonade sangria with boba and it was so refreshing! Loved that they had samples and nice clean location.
author: Brianna H.

description: Favorite boba place in SF. The Creme Brûlée Milk Tea and Matcha Toffee Milk Tea were delicious. I sampled the House Milk Tea and White Grape Yuzu and those were delicious as well. The service was also great as they were very attentive to us and wanted to make sure we enjoyed our drinks. They also have options for you to make your own custom drinks with a variety of tea, milk, and topping options. I would go here over Boba Guys the next time I'm in the city.
author: Julian A.

description: Fantastic Boba! The honey oolong with creme and Boba had an amazing flavor, subtle with just the right amount of sweetness.
author: Jason W.

description: When we walked in, I thought the place looked familiar. It used to be a soft serve in fish shaped cones place. Now it's an upscale tea place. There drinks seem fancy, like Boba guys. I do like that they're open till 10pm though. It's great to have a late-ish option. And I checked it out after 9pm and there were still plenty of people there. Since it was kinda late, I didn't want caffeine and got their strawberry milk bar, which is basically milk with strawberry syrup. Unfortunately they didn't have honey boba when I went so I had to settle for the crystal boba, which was ok but I would've preferred regular boba. Drink was good. Not too sweet but I was able to customize the sweetness level (less sweet) and ice too (less ice). Service was great - I was greated right away and also offered a sample. I tried the honey oolong and it was quite refreshing - might have to get that next time, with boba hopefully.
author: Alison W.

description:
Employees were great! Very friendly and are willing to let you sample some things! 

I got the Matcha Toffee with pea milk (taste like soy milk) which made it creamy! I love that the matcha flavor was strong and I can taste the bitterness, because I ordered it 0% sugar. 

I would come back hear and try the Creme Brûlée!!! It looks delicious :)
author: Melissa R.

description: Really like their green tea toffee boba! The crunch adds a really nice texture to the mix! I can't say the same for the creme brûlée. Half way through my drink, it felt like the toffee pieces melted making the drink overly sweet. That or it's the syrup that separated and made the second half of the drink overly sweet. Definitely will be back for green tea toffee though!
author: Mindy C.

description:
That was one, if not THE best milk tea I've had. It had a strong tea flavor that was complex and not diluted too far by the cream. The other drinks are stellar as well. (The others I tried were Bae-sil and Forever Young). The drinks are just right at the regular sweet but if you have a sweet tooth, they have a step above the regular. 

Ps. The drinks were so good, I had 2 in one sitting.
author: Greg S.

description: Urban has great drinks, amazing service, and a beautiful ambience. I really like the simplicity of the menu and the fact that they offer unconventional dairy free options such as pea milk and oat milk. The pea milk is delicious! The tea they offer definitely has a strong taste to it and I like the fact that their drinks aren't too sweet. My favorite is the strawberry milk bar with pea milk. But all their drinks are honestly really good. The boba is always so good too! Great place that offers new refreshing drinks. Definitely my new favorite boba place in the city.
author: Michael Y.

description: No bathroom. Horrible place to work out of if there is no bathroom. They also falsely advertise that there is one.
author: Taher S.

description: Hands down the highest quality boba around. The tapioca pearls are warm in your drink!!! Plus, the creme brulee flavor is so delicious. You can taste the crunch too!
author: Vivy C.

description: Had the Basil, Jasmine tea with Macadamian milk and the mochi muffin. All-in-all, this was a good experience but they were out of the Oat milk. My only thought was I wish there was more seating.
author: Lil R.

description:
I came for the first time today and tried the creme brûlée.
It was very good!! Also, the store is very clean and the employees are very friendly and care if you are enjoying their drinks.  I'll definitely be back when I'm in the area.
author: Tania K.

description: I don't usually try new boba places since I've been spoiled by Boba Guys but this place is actually really good. They offer a ton of alternative milks which is great if you dislike or cant drink cow, almond, or soy milk. I got a hibiscus tea with oatmilk which tasted great, definitely on par with the level of Boba Guys. Its sort of an unknown quaint place but it is definitely worth a try if your looking for boba that actually tastes good; something that isn't too easy to come by in my opinion.
author: Kapilan V.

description: Seriously thrilled that I found this Boba shop in my neighborhood! It is a real game changer. I was going to Boba Guys but this is 100% better, cheaper, friendlier, and less of the hype. The tapioca is soft and tender, the tea is high quality and they have 3 different milk substitutes. Plus they don't add ice (trick to give you less tea) nor charge you more for less ice like another well known Boba cafe. I would TOTALLY RECOMMEND this place! If you're a first timer, or Boba veteran your bound to enjoy drink.
author: Abigail S.

description: I have had Milk Tea at almost every single bubble tea house in SF and Urban Ritual delivers the best I have ever had. The freshness of the tea and the deep flavor can be enjoyed in every sip. The quality and sweetness of the honey boba pearls are such a great compliment to the creamy black tea. You can truly tell they don't use powdered tea and it shows. Be sure to compliment David and his awesome staff as well.
author: Zack K.

description: Honestly innovative flavors and the tea is top notch. Almost comparable to Boba Guys in quality in the tea and milk they use. Got the Matcha Toffee and it was strong in macha flavor with the little bits of toffee. Never had anything like it and I was impressed. The drink was more on the tea side and wasn't as milky which is how I like my milk tea. Would come again to try their other flavors cause the flavors here are very unique.
author: Chloe J.

description: Loved their creme brûlée drink. Didn't stay in but the place looked nice. Saw some kids playing games so they have some things you can do inside. Really chill atmosphere. Your typical, cool boba place
author: Isabel B.

description: I got the chrysanthemum tea and it was amazing! I don't know what other boba places sells chrysanthemum tea so I was super excited about this. It's so light and refreshing but not too sweet. My only complaint is that this place doesn't have any bathrooms so I had to walk around and ask other stores for a bathroom.
author: Jenny D.

description: Yay for another boba place near my place! I forgot what used to be here but R says he remember an ice cream or fro-yo place in it before. Either ways, yes, parking is terrible here but honestly, Hayes Valley doesn't have the best parking. I recommend you either park afar and walk over or take the bart/muni and walk a bit. The place is not very big but it's rare for boba places to be big in SF though. I usually get to-go. They have small samples of different kinds of tea in the front that you can sample. The menu isn't full of your traditional boba that you've seen at other stores. I only like their jasmine green milk tea. Their boba is soft and chewy, so that's good. I had the strawberry milk tea before and it was super sweet. Their strawberry syrup was pure sugar. And the milk interacted weirdly with it. Beyond that,  it can be pricey but it is Hayes Valley. It's still nice to grab boba later in the evening instead of heading far out for some.
author: Michelle R.

description: Their boba teas are so good. You can taste the quality of the tea! The creme brûlée topping is so so so good... I absolutely love coming here.
author: Mae Y.

description: Delicious! I love the multiple dairy alternatives available. The woman at the counter is also very sweet and helpful.
author: Catherine M.

description:
Got the house milk tea, it was delicious! Not too sweet and you can taste the tea and they use real tea. Unlike some places that use powder for shortcuts. My sister got the match toffee which is also really good! Comes with real toffee bits and I recommend both. They also have samples at the counter. 

Environment is chill and employees are friendly and helpful with decisions. Will be coming back!
author: Kailee M.

description: If heaven was a drink, it would taste like anything on the menu at urban ritual. I can absolutely recommend the matcha /toffee. Service was great. I'm hooked.
author: Tyler D.

description: Don't know why this place has a 4.5 star rating. Tapioca is high quality, but the milk tea is just too watery.
author: Isaac N.

description: Milk tea, the kind that isn't too sweet and where you can taste the tea. The creme brûlée was delicious and not overly sweet, very creamy. It also had actual pudding and caramelized bits of sugar inside which was fantastic. Their normal milk tea was similar, with a slightly stronger tea flavor that shows the quality of their tea. I don't drink milk tea, but will be coming back.
author: Michael J.

description: Drinks are good and definitely different from Boba Guys. I think if you are strawberry matcha latte fan of Boba Guys you should try some of the drinks here. I've had the matcha toffee and creme brûlée drink, both were fantastic. Definitely hope this place sticks around as it is a solid addition to the area.
author: C W.

description: My boyfriend and I got the honey oolong and the white grape yuzu with honey boba! The employees were very friendly and helpful. The drinks were refreshing, delicate, and well balanced. We both got regular sweetness (75%) which was perfect. We'll be back!
author: Jaz W.

description: GET THE MATCHA TOFFEE (less sugar). It's so good! This place is very cute and decently priced. All the drinks are extremely pretty, too. Located in Hayes Valley, this is a must if you have a sweet tooth or want a dessert drink.
author: Xijing Z.

description: BEST BOBA SHOP IN SAN FRANCISCO. I'm a huge Boba Guys fan and this one easily takes the cake. I order my drinks with minimal sugar and toppings. Often times, the addition of sugar can mask the flavor of the tea or whatever else (non dairy creamer additives) gets thrown into your drink as "milk tea". This place, however, passed the test. I got the Jasmine milk tea with less sugar and it was honestly the best boba drink I've ever had. There is a strong tea flavor while being equally creamy. Everything was just right about this drink. My friends ordered the white grape and matcha with toffee. Those were also very good. Highly recommend!
author: Chinh N.

description: So glad that urban ritual has moved to hayes valley at its official location! Their soft opening hours are 12-8. I love the creme brulee drink that has real creme brulee topping inside, honey boba, and milk. Its sweet and creamy. The matcha toffee is also really good and you can get your drinks with oat milk or pea milk as a non dairy option! They have a lot of unique flavors and I'll definitely be back to try more.
author: Kimberly L.

description:
Friendly staff who are always accommodating and helpful, interesting and extremely delicious tea flavors!

Urban Ritual is a great addition to Hayes Valley
author: Ashley D.

description: Great Boba, great location, really cute vibe! However the wall on the right when you walk in is pretty bare... They really need some air plants, or succulents, or some type of decoration to make it have a more homey vibe so you want to spend more than two minutes inside
author: Candace S.

description: This is a cute boba shop in the middle of Hayes Valley. I usually go to Little Sweet for boba but wanted to switch it up a bit. I ordered the matcha toffee with honey boba and my fiance ordered the creme brulee. Both drinks were pretty good but the creme brulee was my favorite. I'm a huge sucker for texture and the torched pieces or sugar put in a nice touch to the drink. It was also the right amount of sweetness without needing any changes. The matcha toffee was good after I asked them to add a little more sweetness to it. I enjoyed the toffee bits in the drink as well. Reminds me of the matcha gold ice cream from Garden Creamery. The honey boba was also a good consistency. I thought the prices were a bit steep for what it was.. especially since the cup sizes were just a standard small. But it does make sense since they're located in a pretty pricey neighborhood. I'd definitely come back when I feel like splurging on boba.
author: Antoinette T.

description: Hands down, the BEST boba in the city! THE BEST!! You can't go wrong with anything you order! The tea flavor is amazing, never too sweet, aaand the boba is always perfectly made! This place is LEGIT!!
author: Abbey B.

description: I usually don't drink boba but this place has some unique flavors and is not overly sweet. Every boba place seems to have the same drinks but this one has recipes that I never seen anywhere. I got the creme brûlée and it was on point. Not too sweet and balanced all the way through. If you like boba drinks and want to try something new, definitely check this place out!
author: Ben N.

description: My girlfriend loves bubble tea so we've tried at least 75% of the boba places in SF.... And Urban Ritual is the BEST of them all.  Hands down.
author: Eleanor P.

description: This place was suggested to me plenty of times and thought I would come here to give it a try. The store was really roomy with some tables and benches in a corner for people to wait on for their orders. Their menus are really simple to read and to the point and very cute ! I ordered the "Bae-sil" (regular sweet) which Is pretty much supposed to be a strawberry lemonade drink. I was really excited to try this but after I took the first sip, I think I regretted not going for the other specialty drinks. It wasn't completely bad but it definitely wasn't worth the 5 bucks for such a small cup. It didn't taste like strawberry , it didn't taste like lemonade. It was like a watered down slightly sweet and sour tea with a somewhat earthy taste to it. On the bright side, the boba was really really good. It was a good soft chewiness and it was sweet from the honey which I enjoyed a lot. I would definitely love to give this place another try, but maybe go for one of the more popular reviewed drinks like the matcha toffee.
author: Mandy C.

description: I really like this boba shop and I hope they stick around. The staff are very friendly and the store is very clean. My favorite drinks are the matcha toffee and the creme brûlée. The space is nice and they have tables to sit at too. This is one of my favorite boba shops in the city and plus they are less than 2 blocks away from me.
author: Baron T.

description: Amazing service & delicious drinks! I love the variety of their menu. I ordered the creme brûlée & matcha toffee drinks. I also got to sample their house milk tea-- sooo good! Will be back to try their other items
author: Danelle T.

description: I usually grab boba 5-8 times a week, and very few times have I been this impressed by a boba place. The tea quality is really on point and the recipes are innovative and original. I tried a bunch of interesting options off their menu, but settled on the creme brûlée, which was fantastic. The custard was very well made and on par with creme brulee at many restaurants. The boba was a great consistency with a solid, noticeable amount of honey flavor. The tea was very delicate and let the other flavors of the toppings shine through. The use of crunchy, candy-like toppings like burnt sugar and toffee was especially interesting and provided nice flavor as well as great contrast with the soft boba and custard. All around, it was great boba, but my only complaints would be the size and the price. $5.25 is way too much for such a tiny cup, even boba guys with its extremely inflated prices doesn't charge that much, and offers a larger size.
author: Jay P.

description: Came in today (5/15) and ordered the Matcha Toffee with honey boba. Awesome flavor combination. The boba was just the right texture and the crunchy topping they add on is def a great touch. Would def come back. Guy at the register, thank you for the good customer service.
author: Kenneth K.

description:
As an avid consumer of boba, Urban Ritual ranks at the top. The specialty drinks are delicious and one-of-a-kind. You can definitely taste the tea in the drinks and they're not overly sweet. 

Highly recommend this place to all boba lovers :)
author: Michael N.

description: White grape-oolong-yuzu honey iced tea, less sweet  So delicious and refreshing with little bits of grape in it. They have a bunch of flavors of tea, add-ins, dairy/dairy alternatives, and you can choose how sweet they all are. Definitely gonna stop back next time I visit SF but you live here you should go now.
author: Heather S.

description: This place is the best!! Their drinks are so unique compared to all the other boba places in the city. I love their creme brûlée and their matcha toffee. A lot of their ingredients are house made which makes them really stand out in the boba industry!! Definitely will be back to try their other drinks!!
author: Jeffrey T.

description:
My new favorite spot whenever I work in SF! I love that they offer oatmeal as an alternative to whole milk, because it tastes great! I always get the strawberry childhood drink (the name is different for different locations, so I don't quite remember the exact name). 

The only issue I have, is that the drinks are a little pricier, especially for regular size. They also do not offer any large size drinks. I'm assuming they're new and still developing. But overall, great staff, lovely decor, and tasty drinks!
author: Nina H.

description: Stopped by this place the other day during their soft opening and really liked everything about them. The decor is really spacious and modern, almost like a Starbucks for milk tea. Their drinks are also super tasty. I ordered myself a matcha toffee and got my girlfriend the creme brûlée. Both were super delicious in their own unique way. The matcha toffee had a strong matcha taste and wasn't too sweet. I loved how the sweetness came from the toffee bits inside the drink. The creme brûlée was also delicious but I'm a creamy kind of way. It also wasn't too sweet but just right. Their boba was soft, chewy and lightly sweetened as well. I definitely recommend this place to any boba lover since they know how to bring out the natural flavors of their drinks unlike some boba places which use flavorings for taste in their drinks.
author: Charles N.

description: Heard about this place from a friend yesterday and I'm glad I was able to make it to their soft opening before work. Besides having a dope name, their drinks were even better. Huge fan of elderflower so I had to order their specialty elderflower drink.......did not disappoint at all and exceeded my expectations!! It was so refreshing. The best friend had the creme brulee specialty and let me just say I will be ordering that next time!!! If you are a fan of wicked and exciting flavors....this will be your next go to boba/drink spot! Believe me.
author: Hubert H.

description: I've tried the baesil, creme brulee, thai milk tea, jasmine milk tea and classic milk tea. All were super good and refreshing!
author: Derika L.

description: This is the place to get a tea beverage. I got the Creme Brûlée and I highly recommend. The Creme Brûlée that they make is so creamy and smooth. The atmosphere is nice and they have a delicious looking menu that I would like to try more of very soon.
author: Steven Y.

description: This place is growing on me for sure! I've visited Urban Ritual twice now - I tried their regular milk tea and the creme brûlée and I'll have to say that the blend of the milk with the tea, and the soft texture of the boba makes the drinks here so amazingly gooodd!
author: Risako S.

description: Really unique flavors and fresh delicious boba. Staff was friendly and helpful with deciding what to get. Also had a nice artistic aesthetic and bomb music. My only complaint would be the relatively limited seating availability.
author: Matt B.

description: Creme brûlée drink and the matcha toffee are my favorites! Drinks are unique and great! Highly recommend!
author: Calvin H.

description: Urban Ritual has a selection of super fun, sugary drinks. Although I truly enjoyed my creme brûlée  drink, I feel it may have been a bit too much. In general the milk tea at urban ritual is a little pricier than competitors. That said, their flavor combinations are truly unique. I would not suggest coming here if you're looking for refined milk tea. If you're looking for a sophisticated teahouse to take your laptop to then you're in the wrong spot. If you're looking for a yummy milkshake style beverage & hotspot for insta photos this is where you want to be. Overall, I liked my beverage and the staff is super friendly.
author: Diana N.

description: Delicious boba tea! Clean comfortable space and reasonable price in a cool part of the city.
author: Andrew K.

description: Went here on a Sunday afternoon wanting to try 2 specific drinks: crème brûlée and matcha toffee. Immediately as I approached the front of the line the employee offers me samples of 2 different types of drinks and says to let her know if I have any questions. I make my order but unfortunately they ran out of the torched sugar and it wouldn't be available for another 30 minutes. Since I don't frequent SF often I really wanted to try it anyway and asked if I could get a discount if I ordered the drink without the torched sugar. The girl asks the other two guys making the drinks and they give an ok to the discount. I ordered my drinks at normal sweetness with boba which came out to less than $9 and waited about 5 minutes for the drinks to be made. Both drinks satisfied my sweet tooth but I think next visit I'd tone down the sweetness a bit because the sips with toffee and I'm assuming the torched sugar along with the pudding would send it a bit over the edge. Overall, I love the drinks, ambience, and customer service and hope to come back to try the crème brûlée as it should be whenever I'm back in the area!
author: Steff E.

description: Earl grey hibiscus was really good!! I'll be coming back for it soon! The staff is very friendly too :)
author: Ginnie C.

description: OOOO mannnn. I typically do not drink boba, but i figure I give this new spot a shot. OOOO MAN OO MAN, the Milk tea is here is different from any other boba shop in the bay; It was freaking GOOD!
author: Irving C.
